Released for the Legacy series from 2002 until 2007 from Bruichladdich and this is the last release in the series.
Number 6 is a vatting of casks from 1965, 1970 and 1972, and comes as a limited release of 1,704 individually numbered bottles
This is bottle 388.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 26 Year Old - Søren Solkær Photography
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunningly presented limited-edition single malt from Highland Park. This 26-year-old single malt has been made in collaboration with Danish photographer Soren Solker. Matured in a combination of sherry-seasoned American oak and first-fill bourbon casks, it is a rich, fruity whisky with notes of creamy vanilla.
This single malt comes presented in a limited-edition black leather look case, with a book containing 250 photographs by Soren Solker & Highland Park.

This 22-year-old Laphroaig was distilled in 1996 and bottled in 2020.
It would have been released for the Islay whisky festival or some may know its called Feis Ile. Unfortunately, the festival had to be cancelled because of the world pandemic of Covid-19.
SMWS already had this expression bottled and is just such a fantastic release.
SMWS: 29.268 - Essence of Gelfing.

The Ardbeg Committee release in June 2011 which was bottled 'for discussion'.
The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.
A full-bodied scotch whisky from a mysterious Lowland distillery. Distilled in June 1960 and bottled in September 1990 by Scottish independent distillers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 26 Year Old - 1992 Single Cask #64 Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
A sherry cask matured Glendronach for 26 years, this is part of their extensive and popular single cask series.
This bottling has been selected for The Whisky Shop in 2018 and is one of only 493 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.
This whisky was stored and matured for 21 years or more in oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Red Label Limited Edition Paisley 2021 UK City of Culture x 4
DESCRIPTION:
A limited-edition and special release to celebrate Paisley's chance to become the UK's City of Culture in 2021. Johnnie Walker (Diageo) supported the cause and the eventual winner was Coventry. 
This bottle quickly became a collector's piece.

One of the worlds leading whisky specialists this bottling of 30-year-old whisky has been bottled as part of Gordon & MacPhail's undisclosed distillery range.
It is made up from a long list of Speyside distilleries.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 23 Year Old Single Cask Edition #1069
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask series comes from the Chivas Brothers, was bottled on the 28th of July in 2015. Matured in cask 1069 for 23 years this cask produced 780 bottles.
All of the Chivas distillery single cask editions were made available from their respective distillery shop. This, of course, is quite rare a rare bottling and made even more so for this fact. Grab it now while you can.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 28 Year Old Old & Rare 1979 Platinum Selection
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled as part of Douglas Laings Platinium selection, this bottling was distilled at Caol Ila distillery on Islay. The distillery takes in some amazing views of the Island of Jura. 
It was distilled in 1979 and bottled in 2007, a September bottling. 
Bottle 205.

This was a very limited release, in late 2018, to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the first Hibiki which was released in 1989.
Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of over ten malts and grains featuring Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita all aged in five types of cask.  It was developed by fourth generation chief blender Shinji Fukuyo with production overseen by third generation master blender and great-grandson of the founder, Shingo Torii.
This limited edition has bottle art inspired by a traditional kimono pattern, embellished with tabane noshi – tied bundles of strips that have long been a symbol of cherished gifts.  As always with Hibiki the bottle always has 24 facets representing the 24 seasons of the Japanese lunar calendar.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caperdonich - 12 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This now closed distillery produced / distilled this single malt in 1968. It was bottled 12 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Keith - 17 Year Old 1963 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1963 at the Glen Keith distillery in Speyside, this single malt was aged for 21 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

The Rare Malt Selection is one of the best third-party bottlers the whisky world has ever seen. Single malt whiskies range from operational to lost distilleries that were released between 1995 and 2005.
Distilled on the outskirts of Inverness in 1975 this is a very limited bottling and hard to find for whisky collectors. Bottled at cask strength 58.9%.

A blend single malts, from Clynelish and Caol Ila - Tobias & The Angel has been created by Compass Box whisky maker John Glaser.  Both of the whiskies used were matured in hogsheads that had previously held bourbon, creating a gentle undercurrent of vanilla.
This is a limited edition of just 2,634 bottles worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelMortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - 46% This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

This is an iconic old dumpy style 75cl bottle of Bowmore 12-year-old Bowmore estimated to be from the 1980s.  It was bottled when the distillery was Morrison's Bowmore before it was bought over by Suntory in 1989.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 30 Year Old 1970 - Valinch 'I Was There'
DESCRIPTION:
This first hit the public palets in 2001 at the Feis Isle and is a very rare Bruichladdich.
It was released to mark the 'first distillation of the re-opening of the distillery' on Tuesday 29th May.
Each bottle is signed by Jim McEwan and is one of 250 bottles from cask 5081.
This is bottle number 197.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jura - 30 Year Old - Limited Edition - World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: Jura is situated just across the water from the famous whisky island of Islay. It can certainly hold its own with the big boys...this 30 year old bottle is a limited release from Jura for "World of Whiskies" a travel retail Shop.

This Coleburn 21-Year-Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1979 this Speyside single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.4% in October 2000.
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 4291.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Ord - 23 Year Old - Rare Malts 60.8%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
Glen Ord was founded in 1838 on Clan Mackenzie land at Muir of Ord.
With a peaty nose and full-body, a lovely dram and still very rare at auction.
 
This is bottle number 1964.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Brackla - 12 Year Old 1969 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in the Highlands at Royal Brackla in 1969, this dram was matured for 12 years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1988 Douglas Laing XOP
DESCRIPTION:
Douglas Laing founded the company in 1948 and has gone on from strength to strength. This bottling is part of their XOP Xtra old particular range. The single cask matured on Islay for 30 years. It was distilled at the Bunnahabhain distillery in 1988 and bottled in MArch of 2018. 
Bottled at its natural cask strength of 44.6%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle number 522.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlossie - 12 Year Old 1968 Gordon and Macphail 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & Macphail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Bottled at 12 years old by G&M this Glenlossie was distilled in 1968.

Distilled in 2016 and bottled in 2020, this dram has been made purely from Irish barely.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1972 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1972 and bottled from a single refill bourbon cask #9. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of only 250 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
This is bottle number 112.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Rosebank - 8 Year Old Unblended Single Malt 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
This Lowland single malt has been becoming increasingly popular in the past few years with the news of the distillery coming back to life. 
Rosebank was shut down in 1993 but since it changed hands to Ian Macleod Distillers this almost lost distillery has been going through somewhat of a purple patch...
This 8 year old was released in 1982was packaged as part of DCL's Ascot Malt Cellar.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Albyn - 18 Year Old 1963 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in the Highlands, this single malt distillery is now unfortunately closed. Distilled at Glen Albyn, this dram was aged for 18 years beofre bottling. Distilled in 1963 this was bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

A 1970 vintage Bruichladdich Valinch from bourbon cask #5085. This is the name given to the 'fill your own bottles' sold exclusively at the distillery, in celebration of the first distillation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich distillery.

An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
 
This is bottle number 0035.

Bottled at 100 proof, The Macallan Boutique Collection 2016 bottling was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the first of a two batch release.

Released in 2015, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle 39.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

The second release was made available to Arran's community, the White Stag.
Each release is specially selected by a tasting panel of members of the White Stag.
Each release is always eagerly awaited and sells out very quickly. 
Distilled on 23rd September 1996 and bottled 4th October 2016 from a single Sherry butt; #1996/1335, at 20 Year Old.

This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 24 Year Old - 1993 Single Sherry Butt #55
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 15th of January 1993 and bottled in 2017 from single sherry butt #55. Matured for 24 years and then bottled at 56.7%. This is one of 567 bottles drawn and is part of  Batch 16 of The GlenDronach Cask Releases

Distilled in 1978 and matured for 30 years in Spanish Oloroso sherry butts.  The expression was part of the distillery’s Vintage Range released in 2009. This was a limited release of only 3000 bottles. It comes in a stunning presentation case.

This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

This lot includes 2 x 70cl bottlings:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1988 18 3/5 Year Old - Lunar Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
This 18 year old Highland Park, named The Lunar Bottling as it was inspired by the cycle of the moon (the Lunar Nutation) which takes 18 3/5 years. Distilled in 1988, the single malt was aged for 18 3/5 years, then bottled in 2006 at 45.1% ABV. 
This is one of just 500 bottles.

The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.  
This Limited Edition has focused around the close-up pictures of whisky in a glass. Released for the travel-retail market and contains a high proportion of whisky aged in Spanish-oak sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Edradour - 10 Year Old 1972 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
From the Highland distillery, Edradour, this bottling was distilled in 1972 and bottled 10 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig 11 Year Old Feis Ile 2003 / with 2 x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled exclusively for Feis Ile in 2003 comes this beautifully presented 11 year old Laphroaig complete with two Glencairn Crystal glasses.
For those who have been lucky enough to try this dram, there is a very apparent difference to the 10-year-old Laphroaig.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

Ardbeg Twenty One came from a Bourbon cask and matured for 21 years. In 2016 the fan club got the opportunity to purchase this committee release. They most certainly won't be disappointed if they grabbed that opportunity with both hands!

DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.

A 26 year old single cask Speyside single malt bottled by Singular Fine & Rare Whiskies, a subdivision of the Glasgow distillery.  Glasgow distillery only released their first single malt in 2018. The source of this independent bottling is undisclosed.  
It has received the following awards: 
International Whisky Competition – GOLDChina Wine & Spirits Awards – SILVER

One of the most collectable sets of Macallan you will find.
 This expression is a re-creation of 1950's style Macallan
During the 1950s, Macallan whisky was as rich and spicy as modern-day Macallan, but with a hint of peat smoke. This was due to Spanish oak sherry casks becoming available again, following the disruption of the second world war. Macallan was ale to revert to using only first and second fill casks. 50cl, 40%.

This small batch of Caroni, Trinidad 21 Year Old rum was distilled in 1998 and bottled in 2019. A limited release from the now closed Caroni Distillery. With 10 years of tropical maturation in Trinidad before the casks were brought to Europe for further refinement. 
There is only 900 bottles.
This is bottle number 220.

Released in May 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in ex-bourbon cask #15 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.1%. This is one of just 264 bottles produced.
This lot contains 2 x 70 cl.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 38 Year Old 1981 - North Star Spirits
DESCRIPTION: This is a superb 1981 vintage Glenlivet single malt from independent bottler North Star Spirits.  Aged in a single hogshead for almost 38 years, before being bottled in May 2020 at 49.1%.  This is one of just 78 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 150

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.
This was a special release only given to the workers of Beam Suntory.

Released from Knockdhu and when this was bottled it was the oldest ever expression at the time. Named the 1975 for obvious reasons, it was distilled in 1975 and bottled in 2005 with a superb colour which has had no additives.  
It has spent these 30 years maturing in Spanish and American Oak Casks.

Bottle 3729.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 45.7% ABV is estimated to have been bottled in the early 2000s.  
It comes with a striking, wooden presentation box.

A rare Talisker single malt whisky bottled in 2011 for Diageo staff, at natural cask strength.  The malt was specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at 55.2%. This is an individually numbered bottle.

This limited edition 2016 Committee Release of Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’
Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.
Released in May 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in American virgin oak cask #94 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.4%. This is one of just 263 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aultmore - 1983 Flora and Fauna Cask Strength​
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very rare release as part of the Flora & Fauna of which there was only 9 different bottles in the series. It was bottled at cask strength in 1997 and distilled back in 1983. 
This is bottle number 01005.

This 13 year old expression follows on from a popular blended malt that Morrison & MacKay created for the Old Perth series.  It is a blend that combines whisky from two highly poplular and well respected distilleries - Highland Park and Macallan.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 16th December 2001.  It was then bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 4th of May 2017.  This is one of only 312 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series - Sweden #6403
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled for Sweden.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2002, the single malt was matured in first fill European Sherry Hogshead #6403 for 13 years and was bottled in 2016 at 58.6% ABV.  This a limited release of just 300 bottles.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 5035

Bottle 4010.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 75.

The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
This particular valinch 'Cotes du Rhinns'  was released for Feis Ile in 2006. It was distilled in 1989 it finished its maturation in a Guigal Hermitage Syrah wine cask.
There were only 430 bottles produced.
A bottle of Linkwood-Glenlivet 31 Year Old Chairman's Stock.  Distilled in 1981, it was matured in a single oak cask.  This is one of just 204 bottled in July 2012 by Cadenhead's at 44.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 76.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 982.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 21 Years Old - 1995 Single Cask #3048 Taiwan Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Glendronach Single Cask Series distilled on 9th June 1995 and fully matured in PX Sherry Puncheon before being bottled in October 2016.
 Cask 3048 yielded 650 bottles. 
Only 630 bottled were produced.
This is bottle 618.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength 55.7%
DESCRIPTION:
Blowing your socks off at a nice little cask strength of 55.7% this Islay malt is 10 years old. A highly sought-after edition.
Bottled straight from the wood the rich flavours come through like never before.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 0043.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This wine cask finished was initally matured for 8 years in North American bourbon casks followed by 17 years in first fill wine barriques from Bordeaux before being bottled.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 26 Year Old - Vintner's Trilogy II (French Oak Barrique)
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release in Bowmore's Vintner's Trilogy - each released with different wine finish. This 26-year-old was double matured; for the first 13 years, it was aged in bourbon barrels, then aged for the remaining 13 years in French Oak Barriques. The double maturation and wine finish has resulted in hints of oak spiced smoke and salty dark chocolate.

This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

Produced by the then proprietors John Gillion & Co, Stonehaven this is a 12-year-old single malt from Glenury Royal. 
This bottling is becoming increasingly sought after due to the closure of the auction.

A port lovers dream from this Highland malt giant.
The Dalmore vintage from 1996.
This bottling is an assemblage of port cask finishes.
Each year only has 300 bottles produced.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

A blend from Taketsuru in the 1980s which was discontinued in the following decade.
Rarely seen at auction, this blend is originally from Nikka and for the experts among us will deduce that this should have Miyagikyo and Yoichi contained within.

At the time and still today this is a rather iconic version of the Nikka release what was only available in the Japanese duty-free.
The bottle is encased by an armoured Knight.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #6159 - Bulgaria 681
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was hand-selected and bottled exclusively for Bulgaria 681.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first-fill European hogshead #2966 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 554 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 82.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

Ardbeg 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2008 - Prior to the Galileo, this is one of the few age statement malts that Ardbeg have been producing. Its name comes from a Gaelic origin which translates to shelter. Distilled in 1990 it was bottled in 2008 at 46% ABV.

This is the third release in The Clan Mackenzie Series of limited-editions. Distilled in 1996, this single malt was matured in American White Oak then Oloroso Sherry.  It was bottled at 45% ABV. This is bottle number C7664820.
A 'significant proportion' of the profits from the original sale of each of these  bottles went to the Mackenzie Clan to help protect their ancestral seat Castle Leo

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 549

This guarenteed "Naturally Light' was distilled at Tamnavulin-Glenlivet Distillery during the month of June 1968 and was filled into oak casks 2528-2531. The casks were stored for 18 years until August 1986 when they were selected for the special bottling 'The Old Mill'.
There is only 1506 bottles.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 19 Year Old - The Edge of Burnhead Wood
DESCRIPTION: The Edge of Burnhead Wood is the fourth release in Balvenie's Stories range.  This edition celebrates the story of how Malt Master David Stewart made the perfect match between heather and barley.

This dram came from a bourbon hogshead #470 and was a private bottling.
Bottled in 2015 by the Lockett Bros of North Berwick and aged for 21 years. 
Bottled at cask strength and it is one of only 250 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 17 Year Old  - 1999 Hand Filled PX Cask #24 - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill is one of three releases by Bowmore for the Fèis Ìle 2016.
It was distilled in January 1999 and matured in a single Pedro Ximenez European oak cask #24. 
This is bottle number 368.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
Bottle 566.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.

The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 5656

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:

It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.

Bottle 819.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine

This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Bottle 103.
100% matured in sherry casks this 15 Year Old from GlenDronach was very popular in the 1990's before Billy Walker took over the distillery.

Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cameronbridge - 40 Year Old SMWS G4.20 - Milk and Honey
DESCRIPTION:
This Cameronbridge bottling was bottled SMWS an impressive 40 years old. Aged in a refill ex-bourbon hogshead and is one of an outurn of only 82.  A special and highly limited bottling.
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 5563.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1983 Valinch - '1st Anniversary of the Re-opening'
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling is from cask no.1330 - a fresh Oloroso Sherry Butt.  Distilled in 1983, the single malt was bottled in May 2002 to 'commemorate the first anniversary if Bruichladdich Distillery.'  This cask from Warehouse No.2 was selected by Master Blended Jim McEwan to celebrate the historic day.
Bottle 49
This 1973 vintage Bunnahabhain was matured for 14-years, then independently bottled by El Vino of London and Edinburgh in October 1987.  This is a 75cl bottling.

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
From the now closed distillery in Speyside, this 16-year-old Convlamore was distilled on the 18th of March 1981. 
Bottle 166.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

Suntory has been around creating Japanese whisky from the very beginning and was established in 1899 by Shinjirō Torii. His first venture was a wine shop in Osaka, Japan. 
This work of art really is a Japanese blended malt encased in a decanter that is of course shaped like a copper pot still.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.

A classic from the Orkney distillery, Highland Park 12 in the old style dumpy bottles.
Features a screen print on the label.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
Bottle 73.
This 1989 vintage cask strength Clynelish was bottled by Adelphi in 2013 from single cask #3846, as always, without chill-filtration and with no added colouring. Limited to just 246 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 20 Year Old  - 1989 Rum Finish - Feis Ile 2010
DESCRIPTION:
This 1989 vintage Bruichladdich was aged in a single cask and finished in a rum barrel.   One of 105 bottles produced to celebrate the Rum Masterclass at the 2010 Islay festival. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle 17.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #1792 - Trillium 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Trillium and was exclusive to Toronto.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill butt #1792 and was bottled at a cask strength of 61.4% ABV.  This is one of only 556 bottles produced.
This is a 75cl bottling.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

This special Bowmore bottling was distilled and bottled to commemorate the Commonwealth Fly Fishing Championships which were held on Islay between the 15th and 20th June 2009. This bottle was a very limited edition run of 150 bottles, presented by Morrison Bowmore Distillers Ltd.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

Only 3350 bottles were released of this very stunning bottle when it was released in 2013. Only 600 were released in the UK and instead of giving the public the details of their inner liquid, once all of the bottle sold out, the information was released in a video in June 2013 by Alan Winchester.
He tells all and gives away the secret that this dram was entirely matured in ex-Scotch whisky casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Cask Strength Batch #001
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in February 2009, popular but a discontinued Laphroaig.
This was replaced by the non-age statement Laphroaig cask strength.

The Macallan Boutique Collection 2017 release was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the second of a two batch release.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Cask Strength Batch #001
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in February 2009, popular but a discontinued Laphroaig.  
This was replaced by the non-age statement Laphroaig cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 12 Year Old - 1980s - Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: This bottling was matured in sherrywood casks by Mortlach Glenlivet Distillery for  over 12 years and then bottled by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.

Glendronach Single Cask Series distilled on 13th December 1995 and fully matured in Oloroso Sherry Puncheon before being bottled in November 2015.
 Cask 1711 yielded 650 bottles. 
This is bottle number 584.

This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
Bottle 9364.

This is the second edition of the bottling.

This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!
This is a 1974 vintage Speyburn, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for the Connoisseurs Choice range in 2001 at around 27 years of age.

Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

Highland Park Capella was released in 2002. It marks the 60th anniversary of one of the most famous landmarks on the island  - The Italian Chapel.
This is 1 of only 5,400 produced from the Northernmost Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world.

Bottled in 2017, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 2000 it's said to have a palate resembling Morello cherries, blueberry pie, cinnamon and soft chewy liquorice.
Bottled at cask strength.
This Dalmore 25 Year Old 1992 vintage Highland from a single bourbon hogshead was in bottled Summer 2017 by Cadenhead's for the 175th Anniversary series. This is one of 270 bottles.
This bottle of Glen Scotia 25 Year Old has been matured in the finest Bourbon casks. The bottle was released in 2017 in time for the Campbeltown Malts Festival.

This bottle by Jura is part of the 'Elements' series. 'Fire' came from fired bourbon casks, left for a decade the fiery fledging spirt won character. Distilled in October 1998 and bottled in 2008, there is only 684 bottles.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0877.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #002
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 002, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2010.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ledaig - 16 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish / Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
The Isle of Mull's Tobermory distillery opened in 1798 and was originally known as Ledaig. 
This dram was finished in a Spanish Oak cask, this is one of only 600 bottles that were only available at the distillery.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 06/12/2018 this is one of only 612 bottles produced.

This is bottle number 7.

Signed.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition bottling.

This 1988 vintage Bruichladdich was bottled in celebration of the Queen's 80th Birthday in 2006. This is one of 300 bottles from sherry cask #1192. 
This is bottle number 010.

A 17 year old from Dailuaine Distillery in Aberlour, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at the cask strength of 59.5% in November 2000.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 0970.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

This is the first instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver collectors’ series. 
The first Kylver release was matured in bourbon barrels. It was released in August 2016 at 46%. This is one of 1200 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

From the shores of Islay this 15 year old whisky was matured in both bourbon barrels and sherry oak barrels.
These casks came from North America and Spain before arriving at their new home in Islay.

21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

One of 282 bottles, specially selected and bottled for The Nectar, Belgium. 
Longrow is a double distilled, heavily peated single malt from Springbank Distillery.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 9 Year Old 1989 Millennium Malt Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:

Only 100 bottles of this single malt were produced. 
 
This is bottle 61.

DESCRIPTION:
Produced by the English whisky company to celebrate the birth of HRH Prince George. He is the 1st Son of Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and was born on the 2nd July 2013.
This is one of only 299 bottles.
Bottle number 238.

DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 Fèis Ìle release by Bowmore was matured for 12 Years in a first fill sherry butt giving this whisky such a rich hue.  
Date distilled 7/10/2002. 
This is bottle number 534, which was hand filled on the 25/5/2015.

This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle number 109.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

A classic from the Orkney distillery, Highland Park 12 in the old style dumpy bottles.
Features a screen print on the label.

This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
A single cask distilled on 7th February 1990 from Bruichladdich. This dram was bottled on the 11th November 2004 from a refill sherry hogshead #451. 
The hoggy yielded 350 bottles and was available only to visitors of the distillery.
Bottle 68.

A 19 year old refill cask Mortlach, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at cask strength of 55.8% in December 2002.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
This is bottle number 1654.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - 1993 Cask Strength - 100 Best UK Companies To Work For
DESCRIPTION:
This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old...but not just any 10 year old.
Distilled in 1993 and released in 2003 after being matured in American White Oak.
This bottling was released to commemorate Glenmorangie being one of the 100 best companies to work for within the UK.
Only 350 bottles were released and is signed by Paul Neep, Glenmorangie Chief Executive. 
Bottle number 281.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1973 at Dailuaine it was then bottled 22 years old later at cask strength of 60.92%.
This is a 20cl bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenAllachie - 19 Year Old 2000 PX Hogshead #6248 (with Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour. 
Bottle number 309, box number 280.

Released by Suntory Beam following the purchase of Beam Global by Suntory.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, quarter casks and ex-Oloroso sherry casks.  This is one of 1400 bottles exclusively sold at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol.
 
This is bottle number 0543.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow - 17 Year Old (2002) -  Single Sherry Cask - The Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Longrow was distilled in October 2002 and matured in a single sherry hogshead for 17 years, until it was bottled in November 2019.
One of 282 bottles, specially selected and bottled for The Nectar, Belgium. 
Longrow is a double distilled, heavily peated single malt from Springbank Distillery.
Known for its smooth taste comes this rare bottle of Nikka G&G.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Nikka Taketsuru - Single Malt Apple Brandy Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is a non-age-statement expression of Nikka Taketsuru single malt to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the wedding of Nikka Whisky Distillery founder Masataka Taketsuru to Rita Cowan, Nikka have released a bottling of their Yoichi expression which has been matured in an Apple Brandy Wood cask.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 23 Year Old 1995 - Signatory - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
This 23 year old Clynelish single malt was bottled by Signatory Vintage Scotch Whisky Co. in 2019 from a single refill hogshead #2157 for their cask strength collection.  Distilled on 26.04.1995, this is one of just 574 bottles. 
 
This is bottle number 491.

This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle 100.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001 & PC 2005 Valinch - Fèis Ìle 2018 (2 x
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018: The Heretic, 2001 has been named 'The Last of the First' as the limited release of 1300 bottles was from the last five casks from Port Charlotte’s first year of distillation in 2001. Adam Hannett, Head Distiller carefully married these five casks which previously held either American whiskey, rum or fine French wine. 
This was a limited edition, Feis Ile 2018, Distillery exclusive release from Bruichladdich Distillery. 55.9%, 70cl.
Port Charlotte - 2005 Valinch - Feis Ile 2018: The second of two bottles master distiller Adam Hannett created for the 2018 Fèis Ìle (Islay Festival). It is a single cask, heavily peated 2005 vintage aged in an oloroso sherry butt. This is one of only 956 bottles. They were sold at the distillery on the morning of the 27th of May 2018, Bruichladdich Open Day. 59.3%, 50cl.
 
This lot comes with the Feis Ile Ticket 2018 entry tickets.
Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018 bottle number: 0972.
Port Charlotte - 2005 Valinch - Feis Ile 2018 Bottle number 167.
Oban 12 Year Old 1980s in the iconic shape from when John Hopkins & Co Ltd owned the distillery.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

The Stillmen's Selection is a Bowmore distillery exclusive release consisting of 1500 individually numbered bottles. The Stillman's Selection is a part of The Craftsmen's Collection.
This single malt was distilled on 22nd June 1998 and matured in Bordeaux wine barriques.  It has been aged for 17 Years in Bowmore's legendary No.1 Vaults, the world's oldest Scotch maturation warehouse.

This Campbeltown single malt was distilled in 2001 at the Springbank Distillery.  It was bottled by WM Cadenhead in October 2011. It was matured in a single oak rum cask for 9 years and bottled at natural strength of 57.1%.
Wm Cadenhead's is the oldest independent bottler in Scotland.  This bottle is part of the highly collectable white label Cadenhead's Cask Strength series, this heavily sherried malt has a fill level into the neck.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old #3297 Gotham City
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This single cask #3297 was bottled exclusively for Gotham City and the liquid within was matured in a Refill Butt. Distilled in 2002, it was bottled in 2017.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2208 - Dubai
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Dubai. Distilled in 2005 this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill Hogshead #2208 at the cask strength of 58.9% ABV.  With only 288 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

This bottling came to the market in the 1980's and was produced at the Highland distillery Glen Garioch. 
Until relatively recently,1995, the distillery was heavily peated, however, if you are fortunate enough to win this bottle we are sure you would taste the difference!

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

A super peated single malt which is produced at Bruichladdich, this is under the Port Charlotte label. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid. No longer standing, this line of branding is named after a towns neighbouring distillery, Port Charlotte, which was actually unseated!! They were quick to change this and now have lines such as Lochindaal and Octomore…which we all know have some serious peaty punch.
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
One of only 950 bottles from cask 007. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in MAy 2007. 
This is bottle 47.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
