Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from a single bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.  
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This comes from barrel number 140 and stored at rick 35.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

This 14 Year Old from Scapa Distillery was a shortlived bottling -it was introduced by Chivas Brothers to replace the old 12 Year Old, but was subsequently replaced by their 16 year old standard official bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 14 Year Old John Scott & Miller Ltd
DESCRIPTION:
Only 303 bottles were produced of this Orcadian malt. It comes from a refill Hogshead #1428.
Usually the old malt cask range was bottled at 50% ABV which was known as the golden strength because it reveals all the wonderful aspects of a malt.
This particular bottling is at 56.1%
Bottle 69.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask Series -Taiwan Duty Free Exclusive #4303
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled as a Taiwan Duty-Free Exclusive release.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2004, the single malt was matured in refill butt #4303 for 14 years and was bottled in 2017 at 63.1% ABV.  This a limited release of just 624 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 7 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 7-year-old Bowmore, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter & wooden box - this is one of just 150 produced.  This bottling was specially selected and bottled for Robbie's Drams.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #5715 - Grundtvig
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Grundtvig. This is edition 1 in the Founders series.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #5715 at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 624 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #1674 - Vintersolstandet
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Vintersolstandet. Distilled in 2001, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #1674 at a cask strength of 59% ABV.  With only 552 bottles available, this is a very limited edition.
A limited edition bottling by Glen Grant with only 300 bottles. It was distilled on 14th Februray 2008 and bottled 11 years later on 29th March 2019 at cask strenght 57.2% ABV from cask #0013156.

This bottling of Mortlach was distilled in 1995 and bottled 18 years later in 2013 by independent bottler Gleann Mor.
One of 335 bottles.

One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
This is bottle number 0952.
A single cask, single grain bottling from Cambus by Douglas Laing. Matured in cask #DL13914 for 26 years, this is one of just 217 bottles filled at the natural cask strength of 43.3%.

This bottling of Ardbeg was distilled in April 2003 and bottled 12 years later in November 2015 by independent bottler Gleann Mor.
One of 263 bottles.

Bottled and chosen by the magician...sorry, the master distiller Billy Walker. This single cask #7169 was bottled in May 2020 especially for a great outfit called the Inverurie whisky shop. Only 715 bottles were produced from this Oloroso Sherry Puncheon. 
This is bottle 257.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old 2003 Single Cask #1935 Calle Cask No.1
DESCRIPTION:
One from the Single Cask series brought to you by Highland Park, comes this 13 year old single malt.
It was distilled in 2003 and bottled for Calle Cask No.1 in 2016.
It is one of 654 Bottles and had been matured in refill butt #1935.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

This was the first release “Resurrection Dram” and is a celebration of a new era at Bruichladdich, the first distillation by Jim McEwan and his team in the more artisanal, old-fashioned way. Very lightly peated at 10ppm and matured in ex-bourbon casks for 8 years - a style never repeated since. It signifies the resurrection of a legend and the realisation of a dream.   
Signed by Andrew Gray.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
Bottle 1518.

Sienna is a no age statement bottling, released as part of the sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan.
Matured in top quality sherry casks, this single malt is named Sienna to represent the naturally occurring pigment - referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

Distilled in 2008 this dram is from Linkwood distiller and was bottled in 2020. It is one of only 309 bottles. 
The famous badge graces this bottle from Adelphi...Malt does more than milton can to justify gods ways to a man.
A.E. Housman

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2966 - Bulgaria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Bulgaria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2966 at the cask strength of 63% ABV.  With only 318 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

One of the most loved Speyside distilleries, this Aberlour is most well known for their series of A'bunah bottlings. 
This is a 1980's bottling that has been aged for 12 years. 
 
Aberlour is a picturesque Speyside distillery, owned nowadays by Pernod Ricard. The reverence for the sherry-casked A'Bunadh, launched in 1997, greatly boosted the popularity of the distillery, and its output from all eras is increasingly sought after.
A rare bottle of 12 year old Aberlour, bottled in the 1980s.

'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Grant - 21 Year Old SMWS 9.143 Graceful gravitas
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt has been matured for 21 years and is one of only 258 bottles produced. It was bottled to celebrate the Spirit of Speyside festival. It name... Graceful gravitas.
This is a rare miniature (1 1/3 Fl. Oz) bottling of an old bottling Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

This is the second instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver series. 
This single malt whisky was drawn from a combination of bourbon barrels and second-fill ex-Oloroso Sherry. Released in May 2017 at 50% ABV. This is one of 1450 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013. 
The bottom of the box has 1172/1450 written on the front corner.

A rare old vintage bottling of the Singleton (when it was still from Auchroisk).
This is a 75cl bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Collectivum XXVIII - 28 Famous Malts Limited Release
DESCRIPTION: This 2017 Special Releases is a blended malt and the first time one has been included in the series.  Collectivum XXVIII exceeds expections, and is an expertly blended expression that includes malt from every single operational Diageo distillery (28).

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathmill - 15 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 year old single malt from the Strathmill Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 53.5%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1074.

Dalmore’s trademark style is luscious notes of orange, chocolate and spices, and the 18 Year Old bottling is a terrific example. Aged in both bourbon and sherry casks, it has seductive notes of vanilla, dark chocolate and candied orange on the nose, followed by a full-bodied, spicy palate of cinnamon and stewed fruit.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Triskelion - Special Edition & Hip Flask
DESCRIPTION:
First-fill sherry-seasoned Spanish oak butts, first-fill sherry seasoned American oak casks and first-fill bourbon barrels and hogsheads were hand-selected and combined with a small number of refill casks to provide a degree of softness to the whisky’s final flavour.
Three legendary Highland Park Whisky Makers – Gordon Motion, Max McFarlane and John Ramsay – produced this expression to explore the influence of wood and cask seasoning on the flavour and character of our whisky.
This lot also includes a Highland Park hip flask.

A 12 year old blended malt from Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth range.  This is one of 666 bottles produced.  This blend is a combination of malt whisky from Macallan and Highland Park, drawn from a single cask.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old Single Cask #3376 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 14 years in Refill Butt #3376.
582 bottles were produced from this cask at the natural cask strength of 57.8%.

This 1992 vintage Clynelish single malt double matured in Oloroso Seco cask wood casks. Bottled in 2007 at 46% by Diageo for their Distillers Edition series.  This is an early bottling in the series, a very collectable bottling.
Special Release: Cl-BR:170-2g

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration #05
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 10 years in Oloroso Sherry cask #1064. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 05 Bogha-Drochaide. One of 680 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Queen Elizabeth - De Luxe Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: Queen Elizabeth De Luxe Highland Scotch Whisky bottled circa 1980 by Averys of Bristol. This is a 75cl bottling, bottled at 70 Proof.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - That Boutique-y Whisky Company Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
A specialist in limited edition and small-batch single malt whiskies, single grains and bourbons. They have been winning awards for quite some time now for great expression and have gathered quite the cult following. They are very recognisable by the label on each bottle being in a graphic novel style drawing. Each label has a great connection with the whiskies that bottle encases. 
This particular bottling is the first release from Highland Park and is one of only 241 bottles produced @ 44.7% ABV. 
Bottle 122.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old - Valinch 'University of St Andrews'
DESCRIPTION: A 10-year-old Bruichladdich bottled for St Andrews University at 46%.

A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
Bottle 1443.

This bottling is the Wolfburn distilleries 1st release for the Japanese market.
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland. Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.
This lot includes 3 x 20cl single cask bottlings.  This is one of only 860 sets of this release produced.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longmorn - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Edition - Distillery Reserve Collection
DESCRIPTION:
This Longmorn 13 Year Old single malt was released as part of the Distillery Reserve Collection. These single cask bottlings were exclusively available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Distilled on the 17th of March 2005, it was bottled at cask strength from a single first-fill sherry cask, #21952, on the 1st August 2018.  This is one of just 924 individually numbered bottles produced.  This is a 50cl bottling.

An edition of Balvenie's classic single barrel series, a 15-year-old single malt, drawn from a single traditional oak whisky cask and bottled by hand. 50.4%.
 
The label has faded/poor condition - meaning bottling date, in cask date, cask number and bottle number are not available.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.
This 15 year old single malt from Glenmorangie has sadly been discontinued despite being described by top critic Serge Valentin as being "very, very good."

3D3 was produced as a tribute to the well-loved Islay peat-cutter Norrie Campbell, who passed away in 2006. 3D3 contains three malts; Bruichladdich, Port Charlotte and Octomore, at three different ages from 3 different warehouses. This is the most heavily-peated of the 3D releases.

Bruichladdich's unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 11 year old is a limited edition of just 306 individually bottles. It was matured in a Burgundy cask that was filled on 6th November 2006 and bottled on 15th October 2018 from casks #14006-14 that used optic barley.
This is bottle number 201.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis - 10 Year Old 2008 Cask Strength Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
A great distillery in one of the most beautiful parts of Scotland, Ben Nevis was built by "Long" John MacDonald in 1825.
This bottling is the start of a limited release series and was distilled on 21st April 2008. Matured for 10 years this dram has been aged in a combination of Bourbon, Sherry and Wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 12 Year Old 2003 - Cask Strength Edition 9-12 & 14-16.
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 10th of June 2003.  This dram was bottled from casks 9-12 & 14-16.  This is one of only 2148 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.
An old bottle of Tomatin 10 Year Old from the 1980s.  This is a 75cl bottling with the old-style label.
Deanston first opened in 1965 but it went under the name Old Bannockburn. This bottling is rare to come by because its from the 1980s which is before the distillery was taken over by Burn Stewart.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 10 Year old 2008 Artist Collective LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was designed by artist Serge Le Fox and was distilled back in 2008. It was matured for 10 years in 9 refill bourbon barrels.
Clynelish has seen a resurgence in the last few years with the announcement of the reopening of Brora distillery on the horizon.
Comes with 2 branded glasses.
Distilled in 1972, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1983 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.
A  75cl bottling of 12-year-old single malt from Glen Ord, bottled by then distillery owner Dewars.  Released under the Glenordie name in the 1980s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Dundas - 28 Year Old 1988 - Old Particular - The Crackerjack
DESCRIPTION: Only 290 bottles of this 1998 vintage Port Dundas were charged from a single Hogshead DL11693 by Douglas Laing, for their Old Particular Range. This bottling from the closed grain distillery is know as the 'The Crackerjack'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Highland Park Appreciation Society.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #2115 at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #2103 Whisky Brother
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Whisky Brother.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in a refill Butt #2013 at a cask strength of 60.4%% ABV.  With only 552 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.
This is a 75cl bottling.

Distilled, bottled and matured by the Laing brothers who owned the distillery at the time. 
Ian Maclouds introduction in 2003 has given the distillery a new lease of life.

Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2018 Christmas release and bears the verse of "Winter Time" by Robert Louis Stevenson on the label.
Some may not recognise this Glenallchie single malt in its older style packaging. It was distilled in 1970s and matured for 12 years.
Glenfarclas 8 year old single malt whisky from the 1980s. From the heart of Speyside, this little tipple is a great talking point. 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 12 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration Valinch #13
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 12 years in Bourbon/Monbazillac cask #12/202-27.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 21 Smachd Air Caileachd. One of 438 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 095.

A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 0427.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2005 Cask Exploration #06 - Cuan-Ard
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2005 vintage matured for 10 years in Grenache Blanc cask #1615.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 06  Cuan-Ard. One of 432 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Port & Wine Casks Feis Ile 2020 + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Ahead of the rest in many ways, this distillery has been planning for the future since the 1920's when it was bottling its single malt. Along that southern coast of Islay are the 3 big hitters, Ardbeg, Lagavulin and of course Laphroaig. What many fail to realise is that Laphroaig is one of the largest if not the largest producer of whisky on the island. They also were one of the first-ever distilleries to hire a female distillery manager.
Friendship" in Gaelic is Cairdeas and this is the 2020 Feis Ile release. It has been matured in a both second fill ruby port casks and ex-bourbon casks before eventually being transferred into in ex-red wine barrels for the finish.

This Glenglassaugh 1986 was specially selected and bottled in 2006 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.  1986 was the year that Glenglassaugh distillery was closed before it was again reopened in 2005.
A vintage expression from Glenrothes, distilled in 1989 and bottled in 2001. A hugely popular bottle - all over the world, from this Speyside distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - Golden Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old, Golden Rum Cask has been aged in Oak Barrels for 12 years including a secondary period of maturation in casks that previously held golden rum from the Caribbean.
A 1987 vintage The Glenrothes, bottled in 1999 by the brand's owners Berry Brothers & Rudd.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Spey - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Glen Spey is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.5%.
This is bottle number 1228.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Grant - 18 Year Old  - Rare Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Double distilled in tall slender pot stills.
This bottling of 18-year-old Glen Grant was released in 2016 and has since been Jim Murray's Scotch Whisky of the Year for 2017, 2019 and 2020.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

Would you believe us if we said this single malt from the BEAST of Dufftown has been distilled 2.81 times...well you better!! This dram takes its inspiration from the world-renowned and award-winning 1992 16-year-old release!
Mortlach utilises a complex distillation process unlike any other. Three Wash Stills and three spirit stills are all unique in shape, size and have been hand cut. 
They believe that for 70 years, Mortlach has been the best kept secret in Scotch whisky.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn - Ansuz The Kylver Series (4th Release)
DESCRIPTION: Wolfburns 4th release of the Kylver series.   Each bottle has a letter from the runic alpabet, which was on the Kylver stones. This peated bottling has the symbol “Ansuz”, which translates as “god” or “gods”. The whisky was matured for around four years in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and second-fill quarter casks.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.
Bottled in the 1980s by George & J. G Smith Limited this is a 26 2/3 FL.Oz bottling of Glenlivet 12 Year Old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - MP5 Single Casks (3 x 20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 3 x 20cl bottling of Bruichladdich's Micro Province bottlings.

Ardbeg Perpetuum release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 10 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 Fèis Ìle release from east coast legends Caol Ila was a 10 year old expression was aged in a combination of rejuvenated European oak butts and refill American hogsheads.
Bottle 387.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Trinidad Rum - High Spirits Collection - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of  Trinidad 18 Year Old rum was distilled at Caroni Distillery which is now closed in 1998 and bottled in 2016 by High Spirits.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Viking Pride - Travel Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Viking Pride by Highland Park is an 18 year old single malt.
This bottle has been bottled at its marrying strength of 46%.
For Viking Pride, Highland Parks Master Whisky Maker Gordon Motion carefully selects up to 120 casks which have matured for 18 years or longer and marries them together, the flavours slowly combine and gather depth and consistency.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Braeval - 17 Year Old - Single Cask Edition - Distillery Reserve Collection
DESCRIPTION:
This Braeval 17 Year Old single malt was released as part of the Distillery Reserve Collection. These single cask bottlings were exclusively available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Distilled on the 26th of March 2005, it was bottled at cask strength from a single first-fill barrel, #13913 on the 26th of March 2002.  This is one of just 276 individually numbered bottles produced.  This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 96.
Distilled and blended by Suntory Limited comes this rather unusual decanter in the shape of a book.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

This 13-year-old Longrow Red, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This was matured for 10 years in a mixture of bourbon barrels and refill sherry hogshead followed by 3 years in Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon barrels. There is only 9000 bottles of this Longrow Red cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Sweden - Ltd Edition 2018: 1 Single Cask #6147
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Single Cask Series for SWEDEN Ltd Edition 2018: 1 limited to 575 bottles.
Matured in a 1st fill European Oak Sherry Butt cask #6147.  Distilled in 2003 and bottled in 2018.
Cask Number 6147.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Highland Park Appreciation Society.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #2115 at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

One of the not only the Highland distilleries but all of Scotlands distilleries, Balblair is owned by Inverhouse. 
Moving with the times, Balblair has also changed from oil to gas to reduce its carbon footprint. 
This is, of course, the travel retail version. It was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series - Taiwan Duty Free #5685
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled as a Taiwan Duty-Free Exclusive release.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2004, the single malt was matured in refill butt #5685 for 13 years and was bottled in 2018 at 65.7% ABV.  This a limited release of just 531 bottles.

Built in 1949, this distillery can be found in the Perthshire region of Scotland. Picard Vins & Spiritueux now own this distillery which was previously owned by Whyte and Mackay.
This 10 year is certainly an older bottling believed to be from the 1980s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Sweden 2003 Single Cask #4462
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Single Cask Series for SWEDEN Ltd Edition 2018: 2 limited to 600 bottles.
Matured in a 1st fill European Oak Sherry Puncheon cask #4462.  Distilled in 2003 and bottled in 2018.
Cask Number 4462.

Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Highland Park 13 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a 1st fill American Sherry Hogshead and bottled in 2017.
Distilled in 2002 this release was limited to 588 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #4250
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Highland Park 12 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a Refill Hogshead and bottled in 2017.
Distilled in 2005 this released was limited to 624 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn - Raidho - Raidho -  Kylver Series - 5th Release
DESCRIPTION:
Raidho is the 5th release in the Kylver series released in 2019. The spirit was double distilled and then laid down to mature for an undisclosed length of time before being bottled free from artificial colouring. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old Single Cask #3429 - Viking Line Batch #2
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Viking Line. This release is part of batch 2. Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in a refill hogshead #3429 and bottled at the cask strength of 54.7% ABV in 2017.  With only 258 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.
A long discontinued 12 Year Old from the Scapa Distillery in Orkney.  It was matured for 12 years in clifftop warehouses overlooking the beautiful waters of the Scapa Flow.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2006 Cask Exploration #16
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2006 vintage matured for 10 years in Banyuls cask #2170. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 16. One of 428 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from a single bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.  
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This comes from barrel number 101 and stored at rick 6.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration #04
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 10 years in cadiz cask #1248. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 04 Sraid A'Chladaich. One of 414 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

DESCRIPTION:
Bottled especially for the Diageo "Friends Of The Classic Malts," range. It was  distilled at Clynelish before being bottled in 2009.
A 12 year old expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bladnoch - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
In the 1990's Diageo created the Flora and Fauna series. Some bottles are, as usual, harder to come by than others. As it only operated from 1974 until 1993 there is only a very small number of bottlings of their spirit available.
This distillery is the most southerly in Scotland and was founded in the early 1800s. Its Lowland nature produces the most amazing whisky with delicate fruity and lemony aromas. 
Aged 10 years.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 9 Year Old - 2006 Cask Exploration #09
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2006 vintage matured for 9 years in viognier cask #2175. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 09 Fad-Moine. One of 430 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 159.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 12 Year Old - 2003 Cask Exploration #10
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2003 vintage matured for 12 years in bourbon cask #R15/358-001. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 10 An Tuba-Mhasgaidh. One of 328 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 328.

Bottled as part of the celebrations in 2017 for Cadenhead's 175 anniversary. This Dailuaine was distilled in 1996 and is a combination of 2 bourbon hogsheads. There were 618 bottles in total produced from these 21 year old single malt casks.

Distilled at the Linkwood distillery in Speyside, this is a combination of 2 hogsheads that yielded only 480 bottles.
They were bot distilled in 1995 and bottled in 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 12 Year Old Valinch 38 Cask #824 Colin Tocher
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 16th of June 2006, this Valinch was bottled to celebrate the work that Colin Tocher has done at the distillery over the years. He worked in the bottling hall but his talents didnt stop there...in his previous employment he was one of the most talented coppersmiths around!
This was a fresh bourbon cask #824 and it matured for 12 years before bottling. Only 341 of these bottles have been in circulation.
Isn't it special that this is bottle number 2!!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 19 Year Old - Age of Discovery - Bourbon Cask Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in the Glenfiddich's Travel Retail Age of Discovery series. This is a 19-year-old single malt Scotch whisky has been matured in oak casks that originally held Bourbon. Produced in honour of the Portuguese explorers of the 15th century.

Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35.

Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This bottling has come from rick 35.  
Bottle 138.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - London Gatwick and World Duty Free

This Highland Park 12 Year Old was distilled in 2005 and bottled from a single refill butt #1140 in 2017 exclusively for London Gatwick and World Duty Free.
This is one of 540 bottles released as part of the Highland Park Single Cask Series.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3249 - Nor'Easter 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Northeast United States - Nor'Easter.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3249 at the cask strength of 56.9% ABV.  With only 546 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

This 13-year-old Longrow Red, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This was matured for 10 years in a mixture of bourbon barrels and refill sherry hogshead followed by 3 years in Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon barrels. There is only 9000 bottles of this Longrow Red cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
There is 5000 bottles in the Bimber Re-charred oak casks Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was recharred, American Oak Cask.
The batch number for this bottling is 001 which was bottled in September 2019.
 
This is bottle number #4345.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #4267 - Munich 5 Star Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Munich Airport.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill butt #4267 was bottled at the cask strength of 61.9% ABV.  With only 581 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfarclas - 10 Year Old SMWS 1.223 Dessert Triptych: Mushroom Sorbet + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Distilled in Speyside in 2008 at the Glenfarclas distillery, this dram has been matured for 10 years in a refill ex-oloroso butt.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

Released in 2004, this is the first edition in the Bruichladdich 3D range. This is a vatting of 3 different peat levels from 3 diverse cellars over 3 distinct eras, thus the name '3D'. This is one of just 12,000 bottles produced. 
 
This is bottle number 3439.

This lot includes 1 x 70cl & 1 x 5cl.
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
There is 5000 bottles in the Bimber Re-charred oak casks Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was recharred, American Oak Cask.
The batch number for this bottling is 001 which was bottled in September 2019.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kirk and Sweeney - 18 Year Old rum
DESCRIPTION:
From the Caribean nation that is best known for its beaches and golfs resorts...and now its Rum. 
This cracking 18 year old comes from an undisclosed Dominican distillery.

This spicy and deep Elementa celebrates Glenmornagie's skills in wood finishing, an art which brings new depths of flavour to their whisky. Matured initially in American oak bourbon casks to create smoothness and fruity notes and finished in charred oak casks, bringing forth a 14-year-old whisky of woody depth and intense spice.  Available exclusively in travel retail.
Created exclusively for travel retail, 16-year-old this bottling pays homage to the lightly peated whisky of Glenmorangie’s past. Aged in American oak bourbon casks for smoothness.

Introduced in 2012, Glengoyne 18 Year Old was revamped to replace the Glengoyne 17 Year Old. This Highland single malt was matured in a mix of refill sherry casks and a generous portion of first-fill sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - Single Cask #2132 - The W Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The W Club.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in first fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #2132 and was bottled at the cask strength of 67% ABV.  With only 615 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today. This is an early release of Edradour 10 Year Old from the 1980s.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow Red - 11 Year Old - Pinot Noir
DESCRIPTION:
In early 2018, Springbank added another release to their incredibly popular Longrow Red series.  This Longrow Red release is 11 years old and heavily peated.  It was bottled at 53.1%, and spent 8 years in bourbon casks before completing its maturation with 3 years in Refill Pinot Noir Barriques. 
Springbank Longrow Red, is always bottled at cask strength, is released annually in small quantities and every year a different type of red wine cask is used to mature the whisky.  
This is a limited edition of only 9,000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 9 Year Old - 2008 Cask Exploration Valinch #21
DESCRIPTION:

This is bottle number 6.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longmorn - 14 Year Old SMWS 7.217 Joie de Vivre
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Longmorn bottling was exclusive to France and bottled by the Indy bottler SMWS. Aged for 14 years in the cask this is one of only 158 bottles.
This small-batch release is an absolute gem from Glen Garioch. Matured in Chateua Lagrange barriques between 1999 and 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 9 Year Old - 2007 Cask Exploration #12 - Tunn
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2007 vintage matured for 10 years in Barolo cask #1739.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 12 Tunn. One of 436 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 2.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).

This 70cl bottle was matured for 10 years.

This is bottle number 3298.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

A private cask bottling from the Islay progressive distillers. It was distilled in 2006 and bottled after maturing nicely in a sherry cask #1422/2006. 
This has been bottled by Whisky Broker.
Bottle 212 of 300.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn - Kylver Series Limited Edition-  3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Still clinching onto the title of the most Northern distillery on the mainland UK, Wolfburn has exploded back into the whisky scene in 2013. 
This series "Kylver" is named after an ancient burial stone. This third release is possibly the most anticipated yet and means thorn or grant. 
It has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads before being bottled in 2017.
Label: A commissioned Thurisaz in Repose by Ian Giles.

Highland Park Ingvar is a cask strength special edition that is part of Highland Park's Viking Warrior Series.  It was released exclusively for Taiwan Duty-Free.
Ingvar Ragnarsson was a warrior king known for his exceptional cruelty, strength and skill with many weapons.

Milsean was the seventh release in Glenmorangie's Private Edition series. It was finished for two-and-a-half years in 154 toasted ex-Portuguese-red-wine barriques. This highland malt is sweet with notes of tropical fruit and lemon sherbet, backed up with some ginger spice.
'Milsean' is Gaelic for 'sweet things.'

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old (Signed Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6569 -  World Duty Free & Glasgow Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for World Duty Free & Glasgow Airport.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6569 at the cask strength of 63.5% ABV.  With only 660 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 16 Year Old - The Laddie Sixteen
DESCRIPTION: This bottling was released as a middle entry in Bruichladdich's revitalised line-up, sitting between the 10 Year Old and their 22 Year Old. This is an un-peated 16 year old from an American Oak cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - London Gatwick and World Duty Free
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 12 Year Old was distilled in 2005 and bottled from a single refill butt #1140 in 2017 exclusively for London Gatwick and World Duty Free.
This is one of 540 bottles released as part of the Highland Park Single Cask Series.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Scotia - 8 Year Old SMWS 93.134 The Right Hand of Darkness + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the Campbelltown region of Scotland, this single malt was distilled at Glen Scotia and matured for 8 years in a 1st refill ex bourbon barrel. One of only 238 bottles.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

Port Charlotte PC8, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit.  It was the first release of heavily peated Port Charlotte and was produced in 2009 from some of the first spirits to be produced after the distillery's reopening.  The single malt was bottled at 8 years old in 2006 and was limited to 30000 bottles.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929. 
This is bottle number 780.
Initially launched exclusively in global travel retail, Brodir is aged initially in ex-bourbon barrels, before being finished in European oak ex-ruby port casks.

This single cask Craigellachie was distilled in September 1995 and was bottled in November 2015 at 20 Years Old by Hunter Laing & Company Ltd, for their Old Malt Cask range.   This is one of 360 bottles from sherry butt #HL12112. Bottled at 50% ABV.
This a 1990 vintage Scapa selected, produced, matured and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This is a very rare find, an older decanter just that would go perfectly in any collection.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask Series -Taiwan Duty Free Exclusive #6311
DESCRIPTION: This 14 Yea Old Highland Park was bottled as a Taiwan Duty Free Exclusive release.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2003, the single malt was matured in refill puncheon #6311 for 14 years and was bottled in 2017 at 60.6% ABV.  This a limited release of just 510 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2118 - Edinburgh Airport and World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Edinburgh Airport and World Duty Free.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in ex-sherry refill butt #2118 at a cask strength of 59.9% ABV.  With only 300 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

A private cask bottling from the Islay progressive distillers. It was distilled in 2006 and bottled after maturing nicely in a sherry cask #1422/2006. 
This has been bottled by Whisky Broker.
Bottle 221.

Bottled by the indy bottler Beinn A'Cheo, this single malt comes from the Highland distillery Tomatin. Distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2003 thus matured for around 13 years. It was bottled at cask strength 55.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

Kininvie 1996 17 Year Old Batch #001 35cl
Owned by William Grant & Sons this malt is somewhat mysterious. 
A travel retail exclusive which was matured in both European Sherry and American Oak Casks.

One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
Bottle 1327.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - London Gatwick and World Duty Free
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 12 Year Old was distilled in 2005 and bottled from a single refill butt #1140 in 2017 exclusively for London Gatwick and World Duty Free.
This is one of 540 bottles released as part of the Highland Park Single Cask Series.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #3824 - Cinderella Whisky Fair 10th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Cinderella Whisky Fair 10th Anniversary.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in 1st fill American Sherry Oak cask #3824 at a cask strength of 59% ABV.  With only 594 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

Since prohibition, surplus Bourbon casks are the predominant wood for maturing Scotch. This 16-Year-Old Bruichladdich has been matured in Jim Beam casks with additional cask evolution in fresh American oak from Buffalo Trace. An American Classic – Bruichladdich in white oak.  This bottling was launched to commemorate the 75th anniversary since US Prohibition was abolished.

One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
Bottle 1516.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6324 - Sisu
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Sisu.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill puncheon #6324 at the cask strength of 60.2% ABV.  With only 390 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

Bottled at 100 Proof, this blended malt has been aged for at least 8 years. 
It is from the 1970s and has a crest of Buchaillie Etive Mor of the front label. This mountain is part of Scotlands mountain group called the Munros, this is any mountain over 3000 feet. There are a few other stipulations...but you get the gist of it!

This single cask bottling by Whisky Broker is a Apil 2007 vinatge 13 Year Old Dalmore.  Matured in cask #702099, then split into 4 small Oloroso octaves in 30th January 2019. It was then bottled in 29th June 2020 at 54.7%. This is one of 216 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 55

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Viking Pride
DESCRIPTION:
Viking Pride by Highland Park is an 18 year old single malt.
This bottle has been bottled at its marrying strength of 46%.
For Viking Pride, Highland Parks Master Whisky Maker Gordon Motion carefully selects up to 120 casks which have matured for 18 years or longer and marries them together, the flavours slowly combine and gather depth and consistency.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - 2005 Single Cask Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland Cask #2390
DESCRIPTION: A 14 year old single cask Highland Park bottled for the Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland in 2019.  It was from cask no. 2390 which was a 1st fill American Sherry Oak puncheon.  This is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and is one of 657 Bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 11 Year Old - 2005 Cask Exploration Valinch #15
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2005 vintage matured for 11 years in Fresh Bourbon cask #1905.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 15 Barcadh Nan Tonn.  One of 288 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 99.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask #6204 - Runa (25th Anniversary)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for the 25th Anniversary of Runa. Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6204 and bottled aat the cask strength of 62% ABV.  With only 618 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfarclas - 21 Years Old - Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland
DESCRIPTION:
Glenfarclas 21 Year Old is one of the most iconic Speyside drams - it is seen as a classic by many. It is heavily sherried dram, rich and full-bodied making it rank right up there with the best of Speyside malts.
This release of Glenfarclas 21 Year old for the Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland was bottled at 47.9%, opposed to 43% that the 21 Year Old is typically bottled at. This is one of 227 individually numbered bottles released.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 9 Year Old - 2006 Cask Exploration #07
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2006 vintage matured for 9 years in Rivesaltes cask #1653. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 07 Eolas An Deididh. One of 393 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 174.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Rum Company - 3 Year Old - O Reizinho - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottling of rum produced by Portugal's O Reizinho from That Boutique-y Rum Company. This is a 3-year-old expression, Batch 1 is a release of 1,936 bottles.
This is bottle number 1493.

This single cask bottling by Whisky Broker is a Apil 2007 vinatge 13 Year Old Dalmore.  Matured in cask #702099, then split into 4 small Oloroso octaves in 30th January 2019. It was then bottled in July 2019 at 54.7%. This is one of 216 bottles.
 
 This is bottle 116.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 9 Year Old - 2008 Cask Exploration #17
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2008 vintage matured for 9 years in Premier Cru Claret #3481. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 17 Foghar an Eorna. One of 360 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Whisky Company - 26 Year Old Blend #1 Batch #4
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
This is batch 4 of their blended series. Only 322 bottles were produced.

Bladnoch distillery forum is a great great concept created by Raymond Armstrong. When he bought over Bladnoch distillery he started an online forum to keep his friends and single malt enthusiasts up to date and informed about how the distillery was progressing. 
In 2005 they started to bottle singke casks which is where this lovely Tomatin comes in. It has been aged for 16 years in cask #6925 which was distilled in 1988.

This is the very first edition of Glengoyne Cask Strength that was first released in 2012. A combination of first-fill sherry-matured whisky and refill-matured malt resulted in a very flavourful bottling. Bottled at the cask strength of 58.7%.

A limited edition from Wolfburn Distillery to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the end of The First World War.  A total of 1918 bottles were produced and sold exclusively from the distillery and through the Carnegie Whisky Cellars in Dornoch.  This project is important to both companies and was proposed to Wolfburn Distillery due to the owners of Wolfburn being former British Servicemen and the importance of the Poppy Appeal to all service personnel and their families.
It's a lightly peated single malt, featuring a small portion of the whisky drawn from sherry casks, and has been bottled at 46% ABV.

This distillery is now closed but the name remains. It comes from Bruichladdich and is produced exclusively with Scottish barley.
50% matured in first-fill American bourbon, while the remaining 50% was matured in second-fill French wine casks.
After this, the two whiskies were combined for a year in Bordeaux wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 8 Year Old SMWS 26.143 Candles and Candles + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Highland single malt has been matured for 8 years after being distilled at Clynelish distillery on the 19th of Sept 2011. 
It was a 2nd fill ex-bourbon barrel.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longmorn - 14 Year Old SMWS 7.217 Joie de Vivre + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Longmorn bottling was exclusive to France and bottled by the Indy bottler SMWS. Aged for 14 years in the cask this is one of only 158 bottles.

This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.
Originally a travel retail exclusive released in 2012, this special bottling celebrates the 125th anniversary of Glenfiddich's opening, with spirit running from the stills on Christmas day 1887.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #140
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Highland Park 10 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a 1st Fill American Oak and bottled in 2018. 
Distilled in 2008 this released was limited to 618 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

The Distillers Edition is a special release from Talisker, the single malt was double matured with a finishing period in a sweet amoroso cask-wood. 
The limited-edition bottle was distilled in 2000 and bottled at 45.8%.
The Distillers Edition Series features a small number of casks from 6 distilleries that were hand-selected for double maturing.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

This is one of only 4111 bottles and is from Mackmyra Efva.
It is part of the distillery's 'Moment' series and has been matured in Oloroso and birch sap wine casks.
It is special because the casks were selected by Efva Attling who is a Swedish jewellery designer.

Produced from the unspoiled land of Islay, this beautiful malt has been aged for 18 years in the famous Vaults. Bowmore is in the heart of the island and on the shore of Loch Indaal.
Regarded as one of the most balanced whiskies in the world, this expression has a wonderfully creamy nose with a complex palate.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

This single cask bottling by Whisky Broker is a Apil 2007 vinatge 13 Year Old Dalmore.  Matured in cask #702099, then split into 4 small Oloroso octaves in 30th January 2019. It was then bottled in 29th June 2020 at 54.7%. This is one of 216 bottles.
 
Bottle 56.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Black Friday -18 Year Old - 2018 - The Whisky Exchange
DESCRIPTION:
