This limited release of Highland Park, or to be more politically correct..."Orkney Single Malt" from Elixir Distillers.
1400 bottles were released at general sale to celebrate Black Friday.
This expression was bottled in October of 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

This is the very first edition of Glengoyne Cask Strength that was first released in 2012. A combination of first-fill sherry-matured whisky and refill-matured malt resulted in a very flavourful bottling. Bottled at the cask strength of 58.7%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Ruby Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Ruby-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

A special bottling of Glenmorangie to commemorate our progression into the 21st century, this is made up of only whisky from first fill casks, giving a more fuller flavoured whisky than the regular 12 year old. Highly rated and increasingly rare.
This malt was highly rated by both Michael Jackson and Jim Murray in their tasting for The Whisky Magazine.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #4809 - Whisky Brother
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Whisky Brother.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in 1st Fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #4809 and was bottled at a cask strength of 65.8% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.
This is a 75cl bottling.
This discontinued Longmorn was bottled after being matured in oak casks for 15 years in the heart of the Scottish Highands.
Macallan Gold in a beautiful presentation box complete with an Oak stopper. Ernie Button is a photographer that has started to work with Macallan a lot due to their similar nature in style.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tomatin - 21 Year Old - Batch 1 - That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
The first independent bottling of Tomatin single malt Scotch whisky from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a caramel-rich 21 year old expression
This bottle is from batch 1 and is one of 304 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 179.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak - Ernie Button
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  This special bottling comes in a limited edition box showcasing work of photographer Ernie Button.
The single malt has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
This is said to be a balanced 18 Year Old - time has tamed the peatiness, with the raw Islay character being tempered by a robust oak influence.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 15 Year Old Dragons Dram Private Cask #1115
DESCRIPTION:
Only 258 bottles of this wonderfully dark single malt were produced from the Arran distillery. The dragon's dram is the second in a series of distillery exclusive bottlings. Each cask has been chosen via a blind tasting by one of the many characters either working in the distillery or the visitor centre at LochRanza. 
This is a sherry hogshead that was distilled in 1998 and bottled on the 8th of November 2013. Only 258 bottles were produced from cask 1998/1115.
Bottle number 167.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - Collectors Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies. This is the special Collectors edition.
Bottle number 008625.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - 15 Year Old (2002) - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This Auchrosik was distilled in October 2002 and bottled 17 years later in January 2018 at 50%, by Hunter Laing for The Old Malt Cask range. This is one of only 341 bottles charged from refill hogshead #14652.

Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Scotia - 10 Year Old SMWS 93.129 For sharing with good company.
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Scotia produces some of the finest single malts in Scotland. It was founded in 1832 down in Campbeltown.
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This is the 2020 release for the Campletown malts festival and is one of 225 bottles. Bottled at 10 years old.

This is the 4th edition of Kilchoman's very popular 100% Islay series. This is a lightly peated single malt Scotch whisky (even compared with their Machir Bay and Loch Gorm), made with barley which was grown on Islay.  To create this release, they used a combination of four and five-year-old whiskies from first-fill bourbon barrels (40 in total) and bottled it without chill-filtration or added colouring.
This bottling has been signed.

This gist set includes a 70cl bottle of  Dalmore 15 Year Old and 2 x branded glasses in an attractive gift set.
This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further 3 year maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

This 8-year-old is estimated to be a 1980s bottling.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.
This is a Empresa Das Aguas import.

Distilled in the Highlands of Scotland at the famous Tomatin distillery in 1989. This single malt was aged for 11 years in a bourbon Hogshead and yielded 312 bottles. 
It has been bottled by Cadenhead at cask strength of 58.1%.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 15 Year Old - Duke of Edinburgh
DESCRIPTION:
An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15-Year-Old.  This is the second release limited edition Duke of Edinburgh bottling.  It was Finished in Chateau d'Yquem Sauternes casks. 
This is bottle number 1114.

A travel exclusive release by Bruichladdich's Port Charlotte. MC:01 was initially matured in American whiskey and French oak casks, before being combined and finished in casks that previously held Sicilian wine.

Bottled at 59.2% MRC:01 2010 was distilled from 100% Scottish barley, from the Invernesshire region. Matured in first-fill American whiskey casks and second fill French wine casks then matured for an extra year in the finest French oak from the Bordeaux left bank.

Kilchoman's Am Bùrach - meaning "the mess" in Gaelic! Created when a Stillman mixed together some Machir Bay and Port Matured Kilchoman while vatting casks! The whisky was filled back into Bourbon barrels and eventually given a finishing period in ruby port casks creating an unintentionally tasty dram!

This distillery is now closed but the name remains. It comes from Bruichladdich and is produced exclusively with Scottish barley.
50% matured in first-fill American bourbon, while the remaining 50% was matured in second-fill French wine casks.
After this, the two whiskies were combined for a year in Bordeaux wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jon, Mark and Robbo's - The Smokey Peaty One 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
A great blended malt from a selection of the Islands.
Some of the distilleires included are Caol Ila, Highland Park, Bunnahabhain, Ledaig, Bowmore and Laphroaig.
This 12-year-old Glenmorangie showcases expertise in marrying casks. Matured in American oak bourbon casks and finished in oloroso sherry casks for sweetness and spice. Released for Travel retail.
Bottled by a very well renowned company in the 1970s, this is an older style of Jura from the late 1970s.

Introduced in 2012, Glengoyne 18 Year Old was revamped to replace the Glengoyne 17 Year Old. This Highland single malt was matured in a mix of refill sherry casks and a generous portion of first-fill sherry casks.

A Glendronach Port Wood that has been smoked with the peat from the Scottish highlands.
Step aside Islay? Not quite yet...but well worth a try for Highland malt fans looking to dip their toe into in the water of smoke...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tomatin - 2009 Oloroso Cask #3554 for Bi Wines & Spirits
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2009 and matured in cask #3554 a first-fill oloroso sherry cask, hand selected at the distillery by Bi Wines & Spirits. Bottled in 2018, this is one of 598 bottles.
Bottle number 207.

Once one of the biggest distilleries in the world, this Speyside 8 year old malt, has spirit stills larger than its wash stills.
We estimate this bottle is from the 1980s. 
This is a 75cl bottling by Arthur Bell and Sons.

The 12 year old single malt was matured for 12 years and drawn from a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  It is part of Macallan's Triple Cask range which was launched in 2018, taking the place of the Fine Oak range.
This is an older style of 10 year old Lowland single malt distilled at Auchentoshan was bottled in the 1980s. It was triple-distilled and aged in oak casks. This is a 75cl bottling.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

This bottling is heavily talked about and it is said to be a single malt from Glenf...from Speyside...
This older bottling was from Avonside Whisky Ltd and has been matured for 8 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St Ola - 2010 8 Year Old - Orcadian Blended Malt/The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
This blended Orcadian malt was matured in a refill sherry hogshead, this single cask of vatted malt was distilled in Kirkwall 1st April 2010 and bottled 28th August 2018 for The Whisky Barrel Ltd.
This is one of only 82 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Triple Cask Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 12 Year Old was Triple Cask matured in a mixture of European and American oak casks that have previously contained Sherry, as well as American oak casks which have contained Bourbon.  It comes presented in a limited edition tin.

While whisky from the Caol Ila is usually smoky, but this yearly release looks at the distillery's other, less well-known side: unpeated spirit. The 2008 bottling was matured in refill and rejuvenated American-oak hogsheads and ex-bodega European oak butts.

This brand has a great range of traditional Gaelic Whiskies. Tè Bheag; an exceptional connoisseurs’ blend that contains a high malt content aged in sherry casks. 
This bottling comes with its very own small quaich and is an exlusive French export.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - Collectors Edition
DESCRIPTION: This is a Collector's Edition decanter of Johnnie Walker Black Label. Johnnie Walker Black Label is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

After initially maturing in American Oak cask, this Glenmorangie was then allowed a special finishing period in selected sherry 'butts'.  The sherry finish has made this Glenmorangie extra special.  The wood finish range was discontinued in Summer 2007.
Glenmorangie Bacalta is s a single malt that is the eight release from the Private Edition collection. Matured in ex-bourbon casks and extra matured in former malmsey maderia wine casks.

Bottled from a wine barrique #300755 on the 6th May 2020, this dram is from Caol Ila and independently bottled by Whisky Broker. 
It has been bottled at natural cask strength with only 256 bottles being produced. 
This is bottle number 33.
A 2016 re-release of the discontinued Highland Park 15-Year-Old. Aged in sherry casks, it is said to be 'a fresh and enormously drinkable whisky' by John Hansell, Malt Advocate Magazine.
The name Elijah Craig adorns some of Heaven Hill Brands’ finest bourbons.  This is a 12 Year Old Straight Kentucky small-batch bourbon.

This distillery is now closed but the name remains. It comes from Bruichladdich and is produced exclusively with Scottish barley.
50% matured in first-fill American bourbon, while the remaining 50% was matured in second-fill French wine casks.
After this, the two whiskies were combined for a year in Bordeaux wine casks.

One of the classics from the Highland distillery, this bottling is a 35cl. 
Located in Monadhliath mountains just south of Inverness, which is the capital of the highlands.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

Lumina is part of The Macallan Quest range which was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It features four no-age statement expressions showing off the many, many miles travelled to sources the casks to mature the Speyside whisky. The Lumina expression is made with whisky aged in sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks, as well as hogsheads. While sherry does get a good look-in with this one, it's a much more vanilla and toffee-focussed dram.

A 12 year old Glenfiddich with a twist - the malted barley is dried using peat to produce a more characterful, smoky flavour - its name “Caoran” is from the Gaelic for Peat Ember.  Although a resounding success since its launch, this is a discontinued bottling.

The Tomatin 1999 release is limited to just 302 bottles. Matured in a refill American Oak cask finished in a Tempranillo Wine Cask . This is a highly popular expression. This bottle was distilled on 26th September 1997 and bottled over 10 years later on 2nd November 2009 from cask #29457.
This is bottle number 289.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Douglas Laing - 21 Year Old Rock Island
DESCRIPTION:
This is not Douglas Laings first time around the black with a branded blended malt...
Big Peat (Islay) 
Scally Wag (Speyside)
They have followed a great trend and this would go under the bracket of Island whiskies including Arran, Jura, Orkney malts and Islay whiskies. 
This blend is a minimum of 21 years old.

Moine Mhor is Gaelic for 'big peat' - This is a vatting of 3 different peat levels from 3 diverse cellars over 3 distinct eras, thus the name '3D': Heavily peated 2001 Port Charlotte, moderately peated 1998 whisky and 1989 lightly peated Bruichladdich.  This bottling is the second edition of 3D "The Peat Proposal" but with more peat and higher strength.

Mortlach - Rare Old was the first available release in the Mortlach range. The  Rare Old expression has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks and balances distillery character with cask influence. This is a 50cl bottling.
The bottles for this range are designed to reflect Victorian engineering designs in a tribute to one of the key figures in Mortlach's history, George Cowie, a civil engineer.

Matured in American Oak casks this malt was aged for 14 years.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

This is the second release of the Glenfiddich Experimental Series. Project XX (20).  It is a vatting of 20 different Glenfiddich casks, including Port Pipes, Sherry Butts & Bourbon casks chosen by Glenfiddich's 20 global ambassadors.
The fingerprint on the bottle is a print of all 20 of the ambassadors' fingerprints.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Penderyn - Single Cask Ratafia Champenois Finish T-016
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in Wales, this dram was finished for 18 months in a Ratafia Champenois cask. An Idny bottler of France, Gilles Dumangin selects only the finest casks. 
This bottling came to France where it was further matured and bottled.
Penderyn is one of the smallest distilleries in the world.
This is bottle number 373.

This Dalwhinnie career and retirement  the work of Lizzie Stewart, Scotland’s first female operator in Malt Distilling. Lizzie's Dram recognises her 31 years’ service at Dalwhinnie Distillery, working in the warehouse, mash house and the still house. This was a distillery exclusive bottling, released in March 2018, matured entirely in refill bourbon casks. This is one of 7,500 bottles.
This is an old-style 8 Year Old Bladnoch 75cl bottling, estimated to be from around the 1980s distilled and bottled in Scotland by Arthur Bell & Sons plc. Very different from more recent bottlings.

Berry Bros has a history that is pretty spectacular...it has two royal warrants and 300+ years of history. Still trading from its original base and home - No3 St James Street London. 
This is an Orkney Malt that has been aged for 14 years before bottling in 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 11 Year Old SMWS 54.69 A bare flower in the breeze
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Matured for 11 years in a refill ex-bourbon cask, this single malt comes from the Speyside region distillery - Aberlour. 1 of only 189 bottles.
An iconic old-style 70cl bottling of Glenmorangie 10 Year old with classic presentation tin.
This 10-year-old is an older style bottling from Glenkinchie Distillery. The Glenkinchie 10-year-old has since been replaced by the 12-year-old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Gordon & MacPahil 2001 #3000 - Viking Line
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park single cask release was bottled exclusively for Viking Line by Gordon & MacPhail. Distilled in 2001, this single malt was matured in cask #3000 and bottled in 2016 at the cask strength of 56.4% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.
Bottled in the 1980s this bottling is for Milton Duff.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 16 Year Old Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old Glen Moray celebrating the army regiment based in Perth, Scotland.
Becoming more collectable all the time, this Elgin classic has really stood the test of time!
Mellowed in Wine barrels.

This Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old is an old-style bottling from Islay distillery. This is a 1L bottling.
With milder tones, this would be an ideal introduction to the Islay malts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Fettercairn - 21 Year Old  Batch 3 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
Only of only 669 bottles from Fettercairn distillery and bottled for That Boutique-y Whisky Company. This is batch 2 and has been aged for 21 years in the cask.
An old bottling of Glenmorangie that has been finished in ex-Madeira wine drums after maturing in American oak.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Gold expression from the Macallan 1824 Series, and two limited-edition branded Macallan whisky tumblers. 
The Gold was introduced as an alternative to Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak is at the light end of the colour/flavour spectrum.

After initially maturing in American Oak cask, this Glenmorangie was then allowed a special finishing period in Cote D'or Burgandy casks.  These Burgundy barrels, make this dram earthy, interesting and very different from their standard bottlings.
An old bottling of Glenmorangie that has been finished in ex-Madeira wine drums after maturing in American oak.
Highland Park 16-Year-Old, a now-discontinued litre bottling, previously destined for the travel retail market.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Brora - 1972 Gordon and Macphail Connoisseurs Choice 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
The Brora was distilled in 1972 and is part of the Gordon and Macphail Connoisseurs Choice range.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Fusilier - 15 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This is a blended malt by G&M and is a minimum of 15 years old. It was bottled for "The Royal Highland Fusiliers" which is a highland infantry regiment.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Masters of Photography - Rankin - Book
DESCRIPTION: This book is a photographic essay of The Macallan Estate, by famous photographer, Rankin.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.
This 10-year-old single cask is one of 903 bottles from single cask #354.  Distilled in 1997 it was bottled by Signatory in 2008.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich is a pre-closure edition from Whyte & Mackay.
Matured in American white oak barrels then finished in Premier Grand Cru Classé Barrique, this 18 Year Old was bottled for the travel retail market.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 15 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside classic from Linkwood / Gordon Macphail. 
Bottled after 15 years of maturation, these labels are exclusive to G&M. This series is all about how the distillers only allowed official bottlings. However, this has now changed with time and what a great job G&M have made!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila -1999 Connoisseurs Choice - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 2003, this Caol Ila was bottled in 2016 by Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

This 1992 vintage Glen Grant Cellar Reserve single malt Scotch whisky was matured in oak casks, and bottled in 2008. Made available only available at the distillery, it was introduced by new owners Campari.
An old bottling of Glenmorangie that has been finished in ex-Madeira wine drums after maturing in American oak.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant. 
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland. 
This is a 75cl bottling that comes with a leather presentation case.

Bottled from a wine barrique #300755 on the 6th May 2020, this dram is from Caol Ila and independently bottled by Whisky Broker. 
It has been bottled at natural cask strength with only 256 bottles being produced.

One of the largest independent whisky producers, this distillery from Speyside is still well and truly in the family. Run since 1860 from the Grants family, the name of the distillery means the valley of the green grass. 
This unique set with two glasses comes with their great 15 year old expression.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Whisky Company - 18 Year Old Macduff Batch #3
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
This Macduff whisky is an 18 year old which is from batch 3. Only 372 bottles were produced.
This is bottle number 294.

This is the second release of Ailsa Bay's Sweet Smoke - it has had a redesign from its first release. The 1.2 is said to be both smokier and sweeter than before. It scientifically distilled to 022 parts peat and 019 parts sweet.
This is bottling of Famous Grouse - 1987 Vintage, which was released following the success of the 1986 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.
A 10-year-old Bruichladdich to celebrate 10 years of Skerryvore Scottish folk-rock band. The single cask was selected by Jim Mcewen, and this is one of just 290 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cragganmore - 14 Year Old 1993 Cask #1910 - Dewar Rattray
DESCRIPTION: A special single cask bottling of Cragganmore for the Dewar Rattray Cask Collection.  Distilled in 1993, matured in single bourbon cask #1910 and bottled in September 2007 at 59.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - The Suspicion - Signature Vintage
DESCRIPTION: The Suspicion from over in Islay at Caol ila Disitllery, it has been bottled by Signatory Vintage in Pitlochry. It was distilled in 2013 and bottled in 2019 after it had matured in a hogshead cask at 46% ABV.

Holding the title as the most Northern distillery in the UK (until recently), this distillery is on the North Coast 500 in Thurso. If you have not been already, you really should make the effort. They are forward-thinking and couldn't possibly be more friendly! The first distillation from this distillery took place in Jan 2013 only 350m away from the previous site. 
This 2020 release is a limited edition and only 720 bottles were taken from a lovely first fill sherry cask...Oloroso to be exact. 
It was produced for Fathers day.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Douglas Laing - 21 Year Old Rock Island
DESCRIPTION:
This is not Douglas Laings first time around the black with a branded blended malt...
Big Peat (Islay) 
Scally Wag (Speyside)
They have followed a great trend and this would go under the bracket of Island whiskies including Arran, Jura, Orkney malts and Islay whiskies. 
This blend is a minimum of 21 years old.

To mark the 10th anniversary of the Master Distiller, James Mactaggart and his influence on the spirit, Arran has released this limited edition malt.
It is limited to 12000 bottles.
It is bursting with flavour due to all of the whisky coming from first fill bourbon barrels.

This 1970s bottle from the Tomintoul (Glenlivet) distillery is an unusual shape.  It features a round, grooved/fluted glass and a large silver screwtop - often referred to as a perfume bottle style. Very different from the traditional bottleneck.

Blair Athol was built back in 1798, in a small town in Perthshire Scotland - Pitlochry. It is one of the oldest distilleries in Scotland.
Diageo now owns this distillery and it is quite rare to see a bottle with the original labels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - Ten & Blasda (Limited Release) 2 x 5cl Gift Set
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'
Comes with a 5cl of the Ardbeg 10 Year Old. 
Ardbeg 10: 5cl @ 46% ABV
Blasda: 5cl @40% ABV

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tomatin - 2009 Oloroso Cask #3554 for Bi Wines & Spirits
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2009 and matured in cask #3554 a first-fill oloroso sherry cask, hand selected at the distillery by Bi Wines & Spirits. Bottled in 2018, this is one of 598 bottles.
This is bottle number 23.
A peated expression from Bunnahabhain.  In Gaelic the word for “Peat” is Moine.

An Cladach by Bunnahabhain is a sherried expression. The name means 'The Shore' in Scots Gaelic which suits well due to Bunnahabhain's location on the north-east coast of Islay. This limited edition bottling was released for the Travel Retail market. This is a 1-litre bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask matured in a mixture of European and American oak casks that have previously contained Sherry, as well as American oak casks which have contained Bourbon.  It comes presented in a limited edition tin.

From the Speyside region, this single malt has come to warm the hearts of many around the world. Bottled from a selection of casks that have matured for more than 15 years. 
Bottled at export strength.

Originally released for the Travel Retail market this non age statement whisky has Sherry-cask-matured single malt at its core.
It is named for the famous draggon longship which the Vikings used to travel in to colonise the islands in the 8th century.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 16 Year Old - Wings Of The Eagle
DESCRIPTION:
Wings of the Eagle by Highland Park is a 16 year old single malt.
This bottle has been matured sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks at 44.5%.
Wings of the Eagle celebrates the wild island climate. Its spicy and elegant character reveals a sophisticated combination of flavours with sweet fried fruits, warm spices, dark chocolate and marzipan layered as intricately as the feathers of an eagle’s wing.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 18 Year Old Gold Label Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend'.   However, this all changed in 2013, when Gold Label was revamped and replaced by a no-age-statement blend... 'Gold Label Reserve''.

The colour of this whisky is ripe golden barley. The barley used is bere which is Scotland's oldest cultivated barley. 
Bere for this Arran whisky was grown on Orkney before being malted in Inverness, subsequently distilled and of course, matured on Arran at the Distillery.
It has been matured for 8 years in American Oak barrels and bottled in 2012 at Cask Strength of 46%.
This is a limited edition total of 5800 bottles.

This single malt from Dalmore distillery was initially aged in American white oak casks.  It was then finessed in Tawny port pipes that had been hand selected from the well-known port producer W&J Graham's vineyard in Portugal.

Einar is from Highland Park's travel retail Warrior series.  It is named after Einar Sigurdsson who is documented in the Orkneyinga Saga as 'hard and successful man' that once ruled Orkney, where the Highland Park distillery resides.  This single malt has been matured in Sherry seasoned American and European oak casks.  Warm flavours of zesty dried orange peel and vanilla pods sweetly unfold in each dram of Einar.

This legendary Ardbeg was released in a time where the Islay distillery was experimenting with light and non-peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981. This 1981 version was bottled into miniature 5cl and is exceptionally rare and now highly collectable.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.
Black Bottle is incredibly popular. Now discontinued, this 15-year-old is heavy on the Islay malts from most of the island's distilleries.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 21 Year Old - Gran Reserva Rum Cask 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich Gran Reserva has matured and mellowed in American Oak Casks for 21 years before been finished in previously used Caribbean Rum casks for 4 months.
This unique Glenfiddich bottle is infused with a spicy warmth and indulgent toffee sweetness, with hints of tobacco.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.
Bottled by a very well renowned company in the 1970s, this is an older style of Jura from the late 1970s.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 12 Year Old 1989 Vintage Matthew Gloag
DESCRIPTION: This is a 70cl bottling of Famous Grouse - 1989 Vintage, which is the first release in the series. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

Aged for 16 years and matured in three different types of cask; Oloroso, bourbon & port wine for a combination of rich fruitiness & malty nuttiness and creating what is sure to become a classic Irish malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis - 7 Year Old 2012 Thompson Bros
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled at the foothills of the largest mountain in Scotland, this Highland single malt has been matured for 7 years prior to being bottled by the Thompson Bros.
Only 382 bottles were produced.

A travel retail release of Bruichladdich Organic, exclusively made with barley sourced from Mid Coul Farm, Mains of Tullibardine Farm and Coulmore farm. It's an unpeated expression matured in ex-Bourbon casks.

A 2016 vintage Dalmunach and this is one of the first few independent releases of this fantastic young distillery. The Dalmunach Distillery is built on the site of the old Imperial distillery and owned by Pernod.  This is one of only 74 bottles bottled in 2020. Finished for 9 months in a reconstructed sherry wood Octave cask#10825749.  Bottled by Duncan Taylor for The Green Welly Shop.

A travel retail Bruichladdich single malt Scotch whisky, made with Bere barley, which is a strain Britain’s oldest strain of cultivated cereal but the yields are low and the grain proved difficult to mill.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

This Tomatin 15 Year Old was bottled at 46% and was finished in a Moscatel barriques. The result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice. 
It was distilled on the 6th of June 2003 and spent the first 10 years in traidtional Oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold Double Cask Special Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Special Edition - the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars, has inspired the distinctive design of this special edition gift box. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

This is the first release in a four-part limited edition series, released in 2016. The  Bowmore's Vault Edition series will explore four of the characteristics found in Bowmore's whiskies after maturing in their No.1 Vaults maturation warehouse. This first release is the Atlantic Sea Salt edition -  the Atlantic sea spray that washes against the iconic sea-facing wall of Bowmore’s legendary No.1 Vaults is a key note in this release.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.
This is an older style  75cl botting, 12-year-old,  bottled in the 1980s by Glenturret.  This entry-level bottling was discontinued in 2003, when it was replaced by the 10 year-old.

Dont let the name fool you, both bourbon and sherried casks have been matured Tel Aviv sun and used in this expression for this Elements series release.
This release, the Sherry Element, is the first ever single malt whisky that was matured in Kosher sherry casks, seasoned exclusively for this distillery. 
The casks came straight from Jerez.

Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2005
Bottled: 2018

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the Campbelltown region of Scotland, this single malt is an 8-Year-old, estimated to be from the 1980s. 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 16 Year Old Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old Glen Moray celebrating the army regiment based in Perth, Scotland.
Becoming more collectable all the time, this Elgin classic has really stood the test of time!
Mellowed in Wine barrels.
This is an older style bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation packet

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 8 Year Old Classic Laddie + 4 Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
This was one of first releases of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement and this is the 8 year old bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style. 
This lot comes with 4 branded glasses.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.  Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.
This limited edition was released in 1998 to mark the 100th Anniversary (Centenary) of Dalwhinnie distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Machrie Moor - Peated - Frist Edition
DESCRIPTION: The first release of Arran Machrie Moor. Released in 2010, this was Arran's first edition of a peated variant. Machrie Moor is a peat bog on the island of Arran.  This is one of 9,000 bottles.
A rare and discontinued 1990s Glenmorangie Port Wood Finish.  Aged for at least 12 years in American oak casks before being finished in Port pipes.

This legendary Ardbeg was released in a time where the Islay distillery was experimenting with light and non-peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981. This 1981 version was bottled into miniature 5cl and is exceptionally rare and now highly collectable.

This is the second release in a range of small-batch single malt Scotch whisky releases from the Wolfburn distillery in Thurso.  It follows on from the acclaimed Batch No.128. 
This time, the spirit is unpeated but still matured in 100-litre first-fill American oak casks. The small casks give the whisky a big punch of sweet American oak character, balanced against the distillery's fruity spirit.

This legendary Ardbeg was released in a time where the Islay distillery was experimenting with light and non-peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981. This 1981 version was bottled into miniature 5cl and is exceptionally rare and now highly collectable.

Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

A great story of how a cask came come into this world...
It was first filled into a hogshead 700435 on 06/06/2008 before the fun began. It was then split into 4 different smaller oloroso octaves on the 30th Jan 2019.
Finally the 4 casks were to meet again when they were vatted back together on the 26th June 2020.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Ord - 12 Year Old 2005 Cadenhead's Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled as part of the celebrations in 2017 for Cadenhead's 175 anniversary. This is a small batch release that was distilled in 2005 at Ord distillery. It is a combination of two bourbon hogshead casks. 
Only 576 bottles were produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teaninich - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: One of the rarer bottlings from the Flora and Fauna series. Teaninich, in the highlands of Scotland, was part of the Scottish Malt Distillers (later Diageo), which included Aberfeldy, Clynelish, Caol Ila, Mortlach, Rosebank and many more.
Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban is matured in bourbon casks before finishing in the finest Ruby Port casks from the "Quintas" or wine estates of Portugal. Ruban is Gaelic for Ruby.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This is an older style bottling that doesn't feature Shortie on the inside of the box lid as the newer releases do. 
Ardbeg 10 Year Old was part of Ardbeg's core range during the 1970s & 1980s, and the last of them were sold by Allied Distillers during the early 1990s.  Ardbeg 10-year-old made a return in 2000 however.

A combination of Sherry seasoned American oak and European oak casks was used to mature this single malt.  It is part of the Warrier Series by Highland Park which was created exclusively for Duty-Free.  
This edition is named after one of the most important figures in the history of the Vikings, Harald - was central to the founding of the Orkney Earldom.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Voyage of the Raven
DESCRIPTION:
The Voyage of the Raven was released in 2017 and is a travel retail exclusive.
Most of the spirits time in a cask was spent maturing in first-fill sherry seasoned oak casks.
This is a 26 2/3 Fl.Oz botting of 70 proof Dimple blended Whiskyby John Haig & co. Ltd.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Loyalty Of The Wolf
DESCRIPTION:
The 'Loyalty of the Wolf' by Highland Park is a 14-year-old single malt. This is a 1L bottling.
This bottle has been matured slowly in sherry-seasoned American oak and ex-bourbon casks at 42.3%.
'Loyalty of the Wolf' celebrates the determination, co-operation, and courage in a single malt. This whisky is both sweet and complex, displaying a fine balance of contrasts, just like the Vikings - and the wolves - themselves.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 16 Year Old - Wings Of The Eagle
DESCRIPTION:
Wings of the Eagle by Highland Park is a 16 year old single malt.
This bottle has been matured sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks at 44.5%.
Wings of the Eagle celebrates the wild island climate. Its spicy and elegant character reveals a sophisticated combination of flavours with sweet fried fruits, warm spices, dark chocolate and marzipan layered as intricately as the feathers of an eagle’s wing.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Scotia - 8 Year Old SMWS 93.138 Suspend Your Disbelief + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the Campbelltown region of Scotland, this single malt was distilled at Glen Scotia and matured for 11 years in a 1st refill ex bourbon barrel. One of only 237 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Private Cask #09/841 The Ranza Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A private bottling from Arran distillery for Richard and Douglas. This dram has been bottled after 9 years being spent in Sherry Cask #09/841. 
It was distilled on the 1st of December 2009 and bottled on the 9th of October 2019.
Only 288 bottles were produced.
This is bottle number 269.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teeling - Small Batch Baltic Porter - Catherine The Great
DESCRIPTION:
A small batch bottling from Teeling, where they have captured the character of peated imperial baltic porter casks in this expression.  
Teeling has been established since 1782.

This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

Glenmorangie thoughts and the public opinion on this bottle is somewhat divided. It is an official 'crowd-sourced' whisky.
The whisky characteristics were decided by Glenmorangie's 'Cask Masters' and it was matured in ex-bourbon wood before being finished in Manzanilla casks.

A unique and Limited Edition collaboration between the Teeling Whiskey Company and the Lithuanian Brewers Genys Brewing Company. This Teeling Small batch whiskey was finished in “Dark Forest” Chocolate Porter casks to give a rich deep flavour.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

From the Speyside distillery, this brand is owned by Gordon and Macphail. This is their new-look packaging for all lines. 
We see here they have chosen to follow the times and bottle at a higher strength (cask strength) 57.2%. This is their fourth batch of the 2009 vintage.

From the isle of Mull, this single malt non-age statement comes from Tobermory distillery in the 1970s.
This is their peated expression.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!

Bowmore Black Rock was released for the travel retail market in 2014. This is a no-age Statement whisky that was matured predominantly in Spanish ex-sherry casks, this shows an excellent balance between richness and smoke.
This is estimated to be a 1980s bottling.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.

Distilled on the beautiful island of Islay from the Bunnahabhain distillery. This dram was matured for 7 years in a 2nd fill sherry cask #4903.
The distillery is famous for its exclusive handfills.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Big Peat - 8 Year Old - Feis Ile 2020 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A small batch of this 8-year-old "Big Peat" was made just for the Islay festival - Feis Ile 2020. 
This bottle is just one of only 3000 bottles by Douglas Laing

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Ambassador's Choice
DESCRIPTION: Aged for 10 years in a combination of sherry seasoned American and European oak casks and bottled at 46% ABV.  This expression was chosen by Danish brand ambassador Martin Markvardsen.

Glenmorangie thoughts and the public opinion on this bottle is somewhat divided. It is an official 'crowd-sourced' whisky.
The whisky characteristics were decided by Glenmorangie's 'Cask Masters' and it was matured in ex-bourbon wood before being finished in Manzanilla casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 9 Year Old Batch 4 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
Distilled in Speyside this dram was matured for 9 years before reaching the bottle for this very quirky company.
This bottle is from batch 4 and is one of 2501 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Culloden House - 10 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled for the legendary Culloden House in the Highlands of Scotland. This bottling was distilled and bottled by Inverarity Vaults Ltd.
Aged for 10 years this is one of their earliest releases and if you ever have the chance when visiting Scotland, this is a must-visit! Great setting and even better people!
A 2001 vintage Highland Park originally released for the travel retail market, which was distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2012. Made with a high proportion of first-fill American oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Loyalty Of The Wolf
DESCRIPTION:
The 'Loyalty of the Wolf' by Highland Park is a 14-year-old single malt. This is a 1L bottling.
This bottle has been matured slowly in sherry-seasoned American oak and ex-bourbon casks at 42.3%.
'Loyalty of the Wolf' celebrates the determination, co-operation, and courage in a single malt. This whisky is both sweet and complex, displaying a fine balance of contrasts, just like the Vikings - and the wolves - themselves.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 1971- Connoisseurs Choice - Gordon & MacPhail (5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1971, this Port Ellen was bottled by Gordon and MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. 
This closed distillery has been performing extremely well over the past few years.
This is a mini 5cl bottling.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

This exciting release by Wolfburn distillery was both their first-ever small-batch Wolfburn and the first time the distillery has created a lightly peated spirit.  This single malt was matured in 100 litre first-fill ex-bourbon casks. The name comes from where these little rascals were matured: warehouse 1, stow 28. Batch No.128 is a release of 6,000 bottles.

This legendary Ardbeg was released in a time where the Islay distillery was experimenting with light and non-peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981. This 1981 version was bottled into miniature 5cl and is exceptionally rare and now highly collectable.
Distilled in 2006, this Balmenach was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range.  This Speyside single malt was matured beautifully before bottling in 2014.

From the Diageo distillery Benrinnes, this has been independently bottled by Whisky Broker. Aged for a total of 12 years in two different cask types. 
It was first filled into a refill hogshead 303872 in 2008 and moved into an oloroso sherry hogshead in 2018.
It came to its bottling date 29/06/2020.

Launched in March 2010, for the travel retail market, Highland Park Leif Eriksson Limited Edition was released to celebrate the first European to reach America over a thousand years ago.  The single malt was matured in American oak casks, both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry in recognition of Leif Eriksson, a pioneering Viking explorer, as the first European man to set foot on American soil.

Jameson has been distilling whiskey since 1780 but are always experimenting. A local craft brewer borrowed these casks to age their signature IPA.
It has been triple distilled.
This Rum was matured for 5 years at Foursquare distillery / R.L. Seale & Co Ltd.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Spirit Of The Bear
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle, Spirit of the Bear by Highland Park has intense aromatic smokiness from their unique treeless peat.
Intensely smoky with a bold spiciness, Spirit of the Bears is inspired by the resilient nature and fierce independence of the Viking ancestors - characteristics that sit at the heart of whisky-making at Highland Park.

This bottle is an independent bottling from Specialty Drinks, it is a 12 year old malt from Port Askaig in Islay. 
There is no distillery called Port Askaig so it has been named after an ancient ferry port and fishing harbour from the east coast of the island.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenburgie - Single Malt Batch 1 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
Only 183 bottles of this single malt whisky from Glenburgie were made available. 
This is bottle number 50.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Batch #4 That Boutique-y Whisky Company 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
Another exceptional release from That Boutique-y Whisky Company's.
This is the fourth small-batch, cask-strength whisky from the Isle of Arran. We have heard it is deliciously sea fresh and citrusy which is typical of the distillery.
Only 1270 bottles were produced in batch 4. 
From That Boutique-y Whisky Company's - 
The Arran distillery sits on the Isle of Arran, the largest island in the Firth of Clyde. Founded relatively recently in 1993, though the development was halted as there was a family of eagles raising their young in the roof! One of those eagles can be seen on the labels of our Arran bottling, pinching a bottle of Arran from Boutique-y artist Emily Chappell and her chum who are stranded on the island. What would an eagle do with a bottle of whisky, we hear you ask? Wouldn’t you like to know...

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

A fully organic Bruichladdich 2009 - a century ago most barley was organically grown; natural fertilisers – seaweed, peat and manure – were harnessed in a way that respected the year’s agricultural cycle.  This 2009 vintage single malt from Bruichladdich, distilled from the organic barley of Mid Coul reflects the complex natural flavours of the landscape.

This is an old presentation of the unpeated of the 10 year old from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull. This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

Said to be more sherried than their usual outturns.
Only available to the US market.

Released in 2018, Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old is a rich and smoky whisky made by the artisan minded Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known, is heavily peated to 40ppm as part of their journey to make the ultimate “Islay” Islay whisky.
The Port Charlotte 10 Year Old whisky is produced in tall, narrow-necked spirit stills. This creates a lot of reflux and maximizes the amount of copper contact that the vapour receives. The result is a smooth, silky whisky, with noticeable floral elements.  Following distillation, the new-make spirit is matured in a combination of first fill ex-bourbon casks (65%), second fill bourbon casks (10%) and second fill French wine casks from Bordeaux (25%).  The whisky is bottled on site. Neither chill filtering or caramel is used.
This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old is from the older era. Bottled in Tain which is less than ten miles away from where The Grand Whisky Auction was founded!

Macallan Gold was first introduced in 2012 as part of the distillery's 1824 range of non-age statement expressions, before being renamed Macallan Gold Double Cask in 2018 as part of the new core range. Matured in a combination of first fill and refill American oak and European oak sherry casks to create an incredibly smooth and rich single malt. Soft gold in colour, this is the lightest expression of the Macallan range, but still packed with typical Speyside Macallan flavours.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 6 Year Old - Islay Barley 2011
DESCRIPTION: The heavily peated malt for this new dram has been created from harvests brought home from three Islay farms, by Raymond and his farming colleagues Neil Mclellan and Raymond Fletcher. The resulting rich, aromatic Port Charlotte wash was trickle distilled in the Victorian stillhouse during 2011. Matured in 75% first-fill American whisky casks and 25% second-fill red wine casks (Syrah and Figero wine) for 6 years, and has been peated to 40PPM.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberfeldy - 10 Year Old 2009 Hidden Spirits Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
This company is relatively new to market being established in 2013 however they are producing some really good quality drams from their fine selection of casks.
This Aberfeldy was distilled in 2009 and bottled in 2019 from cask #AB19.
Only 171 bottles have been produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberfeldy - 10 Year Old 2009 Hidden Spirits Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
This company is relatively new to market being established in 2013 however they are producing some really good quality drams from their fine selection of casks.
This Aberfeldy was distilled in 2009 and bottled in 2019 from cask #AB19.
Only 171 bottles have been produced.
Now discontinued, Balblair is 'A spirit of the air' and was distilled 'Where the air is said to be the purest in Scotland' - a creation of the elements.

Aged entirely in Puncheon-type Sherry casks, Kavalan Original embodies the richness of the aromas and the mastery of the blend. It is expressed through elegant aromas of dried fruits, milk chocolate and honey. This expression perfectly combines the originality and innovation demonstrated by the Kavalan distillery for more than 10 years.
Japanese single grain whisky from the Chita distillery, owned by Suntory. This is their main expression - a whisky matured in a combination of Sherry, bourbon and wine casks.
A blended Highland malt produced D Cameron & Co.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This bottling was released to showcase the distillery's famous warehouse overlooking the Atlantic ocean.
Glenmorangie 10 Year Old single malt Scotch whisky. Old style bottle and label on this Highland classic.

This lot includes 4 x 5cl bottlings of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Inchgower - 17 Year Old Batch 2 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible gins from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
The second batch from That Boutique-y Whisky Company from Inchgower distillery. Only 225 bottles were released of this single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Moray Golf Club - 10 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: Bottled for the Moray golf club which was established in 1889. It was matured in a sherry cask for ten years.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This bottling was released to showcase the distillery's famous warehouse overlooking the Atlantic ocean.

Auchroisk Distillery is located in Banffshire Scotland - in the Speyside region.
'The Singleton' from Auchroisk Distillery is a 10 Year Old whisky that won multiple gold awards between 1989 and 1994.

Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 6 Year Old - Islay Barley 2011
DESCRIPTION: The heavily peated malt for this new dram has been created from harvests brought home from three Islay farms, by Raymond and his farming colleagues Neil Mclellan and Raymond Fletcher. The resulting rich, aromatic Port Charlotte wash was trickle distilled in the Victorian stillhouse during 2011. Matured in 75% first-fill American whisky casks and 25% second-fill red wine casks (Syrah and Figero wine) for 6 years, and has been peated to 40PPM.

Released in 2018, Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old is a rich and smoky whisky made by the artisan minded Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known, is heavily peated to 40ppm as part of their journey to make the ultimate “Islay” Islay whisky.
The Port Charlotte 10 Year Old whisky is produced in tall, narrow-necked spirit stills. This creates a lot of reflux and maximizes the amount of copper contact that the vapour receives. The result is a smooth, silky whisky, with noticeable floral elements.  Following distillation, the new-make spirit is matured in a combination of first fill ex-bourbon casks (65%), second fill bourbon casks (10%) and second fill French wine casks from Bordeaux (25%).  The whisky is bottled on site. Neither chill filtering or caramel is used.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 7 Year Old - 2010 Hepburn's Choice
DESCRIPTION: This is a 7-year-old Caol Ila single malt Scotch whisky from a single cask - it was matured in a bourbon barrel. It was distilled in 2010 and was bottled by Langside in 2018 for their Hepburn's Choice range.  This is one of 282 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - Wilson & Morgan 8 Year Old.
DESCRIPTION:
A vintage Caol Ila single malt imported by Rossi & Rossi - Treviso.
It was distilled in 2011 and bottled in 2019 at 46% from cask #45/47/49/50/51/59 for the Wilson & Morgan Barrel Selection.

A bottle of Longrow Peated - This is essentially the awesome Longrow C.V. bottling in new packaging, which used to be Longrow's entry-level whisky. Longrow is Springbank's heavily peated whisky - this is a no age statement expression.

The original Tomatin 12 Year Old was released prior to 2014 as it was bottled at 40% (after 2014, it was bottled at 43%).
This is the version where it has been finished in French Oak and was an exclusive to North America.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

This 10-year-old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with presentation tin tube.  This edition is the old style and now discontinued packaging that has been replaced by the 'Laddie Ten'.

Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old Provenance Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
From the Orcadian single malt whisky distillers, Highland Park, this bottling was distilled in the winter season of 1996. It was bottled by Douglas McGibbon and Co 12 years later as part of the provenance selection. 
Cask Ref: 5191

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cawdor Castle - 10 Year Old Pure Speyside Malt
BOTTLER: Bottled for Earl and Countess Cawdor
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled for Earl and Countess Cawdor, this is a single Speyside malt aged for ten years. Cawdor castle is in Nairn Scotland.
The Cawdor crest bears the signature - Be Mindful

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 8 Year Old Douglas Laing Provenance 2009
DESCRIPTION: Bottled for The Good Spirits Co, this dram was distilled at Mortlach in Speyside in 2009. This single cask #DL12101 has been aged for 8 years and was bottled in 2017.
The 2011 Bruichladdich Islay Barley was made with Publican and Oxbridge barley grown by 6 farms ion Islay.  It was aged for 6 years in a combination of casks:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old - Glass Gift Pack
DESCRIPTION: The 10 year old expression from this famous distillery, that comes with a branded Ardbeg glass.  This gift set is now no longer available.
A 17-year-old blended pure malt produced by The Bennachie Scotch Whisky Company.  Bennachie mountain in Aberdeenshire is the inspiration for this whisky.
Released in 2015 this vintage reserve is a non age statement. it is a combination of 10 vintages between the time of 1989 and 2007.
Released to celebrate the distilleries Centenary in 1987, this rare bottle Glenfiddich Pure Malt is becoming increasingly hard to find.  It includes a limited edition print.  This is a 1L bottling
This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.
This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.
A great style of the Orcadian Highland Park 10 Year Old.  It is an age statement that hasn't been used too many times in the past.  This is a 75cl bottling.
Produced by John Murray and Co is a blended malt Celtic malt.
Double matured in port casks, this malt is a toast to the Scottish traders who braved the high seas and were instrumental in the foundation of the port wine trade.

Scapa describes Glansa as a gentle introduction to the world of peated whisky. American oak cask matured Scapa single malt Scotch whisky finished in peated casks, to create a smoky finish on their signature smooth fruity malt.
 
Bottled 08/16.

This is a 1980s bottling of the 12-year-old expression.  
The Deveron and Glen Deveron Scotch whisky brands are both created at Macduff Distillery, and both were named in reference to the River Deveron, which runs alongside the distillery

A lovely bottle of Caol Ila 12, said to be perfect entry point to the world of peaty whisky.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.

Svein comes from Highland Park's Warrior series, which was released for the travel retail market.  This bottling is named after a legendary Viking chieftain Svien Asleifsson who's daring exploits lie at the heart of the stirring Orkneyinga Saga.  It is said he is known for being charismatic, ruthless and a fearsome warrior with boundless hospitality.  The whisky is matured predominately in sherry seasoned ex-American oak casks creating notes of crème brûlée, and gentle peat smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: New York Distilling Co - 2 Year Old Rye That Boutique-y Rye Company #3
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Rye Company, the sister company to That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible Rye whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
This is the third batch in the series and has been aged for 2 years at The New York Distiling companies distillery.
Ballantine's Gold Seal takes in 40 of Scotlands greatest malts. It was matured in Oak casks for 12 years or more to produce this lovely 'liquid gold' blend.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.
This is a 70cl bottling of Famous Grouse that has been finished in Islay casks.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. 
This is a 5cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - The Original (Gift Set)
