DESCRIPTION: A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 8 Year Old -  The Laddie Eight
DESCRIPTION: This was one of first releases of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement and this is the 8 year old bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.
Black Bottle is incredibly popular. Now discontinued, this 10-year-old is heavy on the Islay malts from most of the island's distilleries.

Released in 2018, this new release from Highland Park was originally only available through Amazon UK. 
"Viking Tribe" is now part of the core Highland Park range. 
This single malt was released as a celebration of the togetherness shown by the Vikings.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Long John - 12 Year Old Blended Whisky Decanter 1980s
DESCRIPTION: This long-established standard blend was named after the legendary ‘Long John’ Macdonald, who founded Ben Nevis distillery. Its malt was supposedly a key ingredient, though Long John’s core later became Tormore, which began distilling in 1961.

Valkyrie is the first of Highland Park’s new Viking Legend series.  Valknut & Valhalla are the other releases in this series. 
Matured in a combination of first-fill American oak sherry, Bourbon and Spanish oak sherry casks and some refill casks. The packaging design was created by Danish designer Jim Lyngvild with inspiration drawn from the ancient Hammer Stone of Gotland and a Viking pendant from Upland, Sweden.
This single malt was awarded The Chairman’s Trophy in the 2017 Ultimate Spirits Challenge, scoring 99 out of 100.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

A lovely bottle of Caol Ila 12, said to be perfect entry point to the world of peaty whisky.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.

This book-themed presentation box contains a collection of Scotch whiskies from Invergordon Distillers. The Singles Bar set includes a tasting glass & 5 x 5cl whiskies.
These distilleries were all owned by Invergordon Distillers until 1993, when the portfolio was sold to Whyte & Mackay.

Magnus single malt whisky was matured in Sherry seasoned American oak casks. The release was named after Magnus Eunson, Highland Park Founder who was a direct descendant of the Vikings that settled on Orkney hundreds of years ago. 
This lot contains 1 x 5cl miniature bottle of Highland Park Magnus.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park & Bowmore - Douglas Laing Double Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
A skilful and rather lovely marriage of two very different Single Malts.
It has been selected and combined to create a wonderful balance of 2 different flavours.
Each nip brings you a combination of opposites: sweetness / smoke, honey / heat, citrus / spice.
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Special Old Reserve - Clan Sutherland - 1990s
DESCRIPTION: A Glenfiddich Clans of the Highlands bottling from around the 1990s which celebrates one of seven of Scotland's most powerful clans. This release celebrates the history of Clan Sutherland. The tin features a painting of Kenneth Sutherland, 3rd Lord Duffus.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Brackla - 10 Year Old Navy Wings 2006
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2006 at the Highland distillery, this Royal Brackla was aged for 10 years.
Navy wings is a charity that tells the story behind Great Britain's achievements with regards to naval aircrafts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Orkney - 9 Year Old - Creative Whisky Co. Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This 9-year-old, single cask single malt from Orkney was bottled by The Creative Whisky Co Limited.  This release if from an unnamed Orkney distillery, of which it is said to be Highland Park.
Cask Ref:CM
Cask No. 002

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Deanston - Dragon’s Milk Stout Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: Deanston Stout Cask Finish uses barrels from Dragon’s Milk, a stout beer from the New Holland Brewing Company in Michigan which uses bourbon barrels for maturation. These are then passed on to Deanston for a six-month finish. Bottled at 50.5% ABV.

The Teeling Whisky Co. have collaborated with the Galway Bay Brewery to create this Irish whiskey finished in stout casks.  
This dram has also been non-chill filtered for an authentic finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Rum Company - Secret Distillery #1 - Batch 3
DESCRIPTION: The first blended rum from That Boutique-y Rum Company is a 9-year-old os a blend of pot and column distilled aged rums from multiple Jamaican distilleries. This is one of 872 bottles from Batch 3.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pusser's - Gunpowder Proof British Navy Rum
DESCRIPTION: A classic British Navy style rum.  Bottled at Pusser's Gunpowder Proof rum took its name from the naval tradition of providing sailors with a daily ration of rum, distributed by the Purser – or Pusser. The Pusser would dispel any complaints of watering down the rum by wetting a pinch of gunpowder with the rum and attempting to light it. If the mixture ignited it was "proof" that the rum was strong enough.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 10 Year Old Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION: A 10 Year Old blended malt by Famous Grouse.
Named after the mythical creature that stalked Tomatin villagers for centuries. A limited-edition expression of Cù Bòcan.
Named after the mythical creature that stalked Tomatin villagers for centuries. A limited-edition expression of Cù Bòcan.
This is a 10 year old single malt from Benromach Distillery in Speyside. It was handcrafted by just 2 men, at what was Speyside's smallest distillery.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Vintage Orkney - Single Malt Signatory Vintage​
DESCRIPTION: No prizes for guessing which of the two distilleries this bottling is from! It has been selected by Morrison and Mackay Ltd.

BOTTLER: The character of Islay Whisky Company.
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by the character of Islay whisky company, this single malt has been matured for 10 years. 
Distilled at a mystery distillery on Islay and matured for a decade in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range. Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

This is a 5cl bottling.

Glenmorangie Lasanta has now been created with an age statement of 12 years old. The single malt was finished in both oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. 'Lasanta' is said to mean 'warmth and passion' in Gaelic.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
Bowmore No.1 is made up from single malt aged in first-fill bourbon casks and is named after Bowmore's famous No.1 Vaults on Islay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Viking Scars​
DESCRIPTION:
From the Island distillery on Orkney comes this 10-year old that was made available to mainland Europe.
The packaging reads - "My great ancestors are not gone, you can find them in my flesh, blood and soul."

The 12-year-old is Glenfiddich is Glenfiddich's signature malt.
It has been aged for a total of 12 years in both Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon Cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - The Whisky Society (With Glass) 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Whisky Society gift set includes a 20xl bottling of Lagavulin - 16-Year-Old and a glass.
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16-year-old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.

Jim Beam released this special bottling to mark the date and celebrate the company being listed on the New York Stock Exchange.
This event took place on October 4th 2011 and is most certainly one for the collectors.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

DESCRIPTION:
A gift set that has 5 miniature from the Johnnie Walker core range:
Black LabelDouble BlackGold Label Reserve18 Year OldBlue Label
All bottles are 5cl at 40%

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Viking Honour + Dragon Legend 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park has revamped their packaging and the embossing on this bottle really does look as good as it tastes. 
This gift set includes a 5cl of Highland Park Dragon Legend (43.1% ABV)
This Glenlossie 11 Year Old was matured in Oak casks and bottled by Duncan Taylor specially for Halliburton.

The malt has been matured in a oak casks before being finished in sherry casks at the Arran Lochranza Warehouse. Each of their casks are chosen by the team at Arran distillery. This bottling was chosen by James Mactaggart.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scottish Parliament - 15 Year Old The Member's Blend
DESCRIPTION: A blended malt with a minimum age of 15 years, this bottling was produced by Gordon and Macphail. It was chosen for the Scottish parliament.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glencadam - 6 Year Old Batch 1 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible whiskies from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
This Glencadam is from the first batch made for That Boutique-y Whisky Company. It has been aged for 6 years and there are 454 individually numbered bottles.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.
This popular Irish whiskey has been triple distilled and aged 10 years. It was matured in bourbon and oloroso sherry casks for notes of honey, vanilla and ripe fruit.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Paul John - Brilliance Indian Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: This is from a unique whisky distillery called Paul John in Goa, India.

This Tomatin 12 Year Old was released prior to 2014 as it was bottled at 40% (after 2014, it was bottled at 43%) It was matured in a bourbon cask and finished in Spanish sherry casks. The result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Poit Dhubh - 12 Year Old - Mac Na Braiche (1980)
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old blended Scotch whisky from Poit Dhubh was bottled in the 1980s for Phraban-na Linne Ltd of the Isle of Skye.  This is a 75cl bottling.

Gordon Highlanders scotch whisky is a blended whisky.  It is named after the Gordon Highlanders regiment of the British Army.  This bottling celebrates the Bicentenary of the Gordon Highlanders Regiment 1794-1994 which was named after the Clan Gordon.

AnCnoc 12 Year Old is from the Knockdhu distillery.
An older release of AnCnoc 12 year old from Knockdhu distillery.
This old presentation style Glen Moray malt was aged for 12 years.

From the Caithness region in the Highlands of Scotland comes this Oak-aged rum from the Ice & Fire distillery.
Caithness distillery is surrounded on both sides by sea and lets not forget the infamous Pentland Firth to the North. 
This rum has been described as sweet and compelling.
Bowmore No.1 is made up from single malt aged in first-fill bourbon casks and is named after Bowmore's famous No.1 Vaults on Islay.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: House of Bruar - Highland Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
A single malt whisky produced for the House of Bruar. This is a Highland single malt. 
The company was established in 1993. 
Bottle number 100.

A blended Scotch whisky from the Springbank distillery's owners, J& A Mitchell. A blend of 62 different whiskies from all around Scotland.
'62' because 62% of people of Scotland voted by 62%-38% to stay in the EU.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 1975 Gordon and Macphail Connoisseurs Choice 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
The Ardbeg was distilled in 1975 and is part of the Gordon and Macphail Connoisseurs Choice range.
With the distillery installing a new still house, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. 
This is a 5cl bottling.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie. This is a 5cl bottling.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Viking Honour
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park has revamped their packaging and the embossing on this bottle really does look as good as it tastes.

A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

This triple distilled single malt scotch whisky from the Auchentoshan Distillery comes from a first fill North American oak casks. This bottling has a vanilla and coconut sweetness from a first fill bourbon casks.

Cardhu is known for being an easy-drinking and sweeter style of whisky. This Gold Reserve Cask Selection has been made with the finest Cardhu casks; the whisky has been aged in toasted oak casks, which has led to notes of toffee apples whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - Row to the Pole - 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition, half bottle of Old Pulteney created especially to celebrate their Row to The Pole team, who rowed to the magnetic North Pole in 2011 - the first group ever to do so.
This is a traditional Pulteney dram, with sea air and citrus, packaged in a small sailcloth bag, perfect for hiding away a half bottle when on a small boat.
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

This lot includes a 70cl and 5cl.
This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Timorous Beastie - Douglas Laing Small Batch
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling of this small batch #1. The Timorous Beastie Highland blended malt Scotch whisky was matured and bottled at 46.8% ABV. It has tasting sweet tasting notes including warm syrup over sponge and ripe, juicy nectarines.

Ardmore Traditional Cask is a double cask matured whisky. It was aged in bourbon barrels. The final maturation was in quarter casks to help enrich the whisky due to the smaller size of the cask type. It is a lightly smokey and rich Highland whisky.  The 2007 release of this 'Traditional Cask' was the first official single malt from the Ardmore distillery, this is a young whisky, but it was aged in quarter casks.
A peated malt spirit from England's only distillery, the Norfolk-based St George's. Matured for only 22 months in a first-fill American bourbon cask, it therefore can't be called whisky.
Heavily peated English Malt Whisky from Englands only disttillery, the Norfolk based St George’s. A recent award winner at the World Whisky Masters. 70cl, 46%.
This Penderyn has been matured in ex-bourbon American Oak before finishing in ex-Madeira oak barriques.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in their core range for over 100 years!
The classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 12 Year Old - Gold Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Famous Grouse 12 Year Old Gold Reserve has now been discontinued. It was released to celebrate a centenary of the Famous Grouse brand.  It is said to be of premium quality with a good proportion of malt whiskies (including Macallan and Highland Park) in the blend.

Laphroaig  Select has been created using a combination of whisky from a number of different types of cask, including Oloroso Sherry butts, white American oak, Pedro Ximenez seasoned hogsheads, quarter casks and first-fill bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 12 Year Old - Gold Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Famous Grouse 12 Year Old Gold Reserve has now been discontinued. It was released to celebrate a centenary of the Famous Grouse brand.  It is said to be of premium quality with a good proportion of malt whiskies (including Macallan and Highland Park) in the blend.
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers. This bottling comes in a leather style presentation case.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Whisky - World Whisky Blend 41.6%
DESCRIPTION:
From That Boutique-y Whisky Company themself - 
World Whisky Blend has been designed with the world in mind. A harmonious blend of whiskies from across the breadth of planet earth, to achieve a truly global flavour.
While beautiful neat, this blend has been designed to be mixed to celebrate the way the WORLD really drinks whisky. The blend includes whiskies from: Scotland, Canada, Ireland, Sweden, USA, Switzerland, Netherlands, Taiwan, India, Italy, Germany (Bavaria), France, Japan and Finland.
With 7 Wonders of The Whisky World, discover the true diversity of the wonderful Whisky World, in all its remarkable forms and flavours!
This is a 5cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.

A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Finlaggan - Old Reserve - Islay Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Finlaggan is from an unknown Islay distillery.
"The Lord Of The Isles".
A bottle of Jura 10 Year Old.  Originally built in 1810, the distillery fell into disrepair and wasn't revived until the 1960's by two local estate owners.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. 
This is a 5cl bottling.
This is a rare, old-style bottling from Highland Distillery Tullibardine.
A smooth Speyside 12-year-old single malt, bottled for Marks & Spencer.
This was produced for Schroder Family 775th Anniversary of Quakenbruck in 2010. 13.5%. It is burgundy, late-harvest dry wine.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old Water jug
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This is a very rare find, an older water just that would have matched a set for the 12 year old expression.

Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This is a very rare find, an older water just that would go perfectly in any collection.

Jura Journey is said to be a perfect introduction to the Isle of Jura range (which was relaunched in mid-2018).  It has been aged exclusively in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels and was bottled at 40% ABV.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Inverey - 12 Year Old Highland Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
A Highland single malt that has been matured for 12 years and bottled by Burn Stewart Distillers.
The bottling was commissioned by Marks and Spencer the UK supermarket chain. 
Officially Inverey is from an undisclosed Highland distillery. However, it doesn't take much detective work to figure it out considering Burn Stewart are the owners of Deanston at the time.
This Ben Bracken 12-Year-Old single malt from Speyside was bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. Glasgow.

A blended Scotch whisky from the Springbank distillery's owners, J& A Mitchell. A blend of 62 different whiskies from all around Scotland.
'62' because 62% of people of Scotland voted by 62%-38% to stay in the EU.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.

This Famous Grouse blend is made from 100% Scotch Whiskies including the Edrington-owned Highland Park and The Macallan. 
Famous Grouse blended scotch whisky was first produced by Matthew Gloag & Son Ltd in 1896, and is currently produced and owned by The Edrington Group.

This lot includes 3 x 5cl bottlings of Ardbeg 10 Year Old. 
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This Swiss malt Edition Sigel makes use of small oak beer casks in production. Matured at an altitude of approx. 780 m and hot summers and cold winters for at least 4 years in 50-litre beer barrels.
